交易版简介

INTRODUCTION TO THE TRANSACTION EDITION

英文版序言

PREFACE TO THE ENGLISH EDITION

我。 受既定环境制约的经济生活循环
二、 经济发展的基本现象
三、 信贷和资本
四、 创业利润

六、 商业周期

译者注

TRANSLATOR’S NOTE

我的主要目标是尽可能准确地传达原文含义，为此，在德语词汇没有对应的英语词汇时，我毫不犹豫地使用了略显笨拙的表达方式。经过反复斟酌，我最终决定用“circular flow”来翻译“Kreislauf”，个中缘由在此赘述，篇幅有限。译文中存在一些不尽如人意之处，但这与翻译的技术层面无关。要彻底消除这些瑕疵，就意味着要重写整部译文，而这样做似乎并不明智。熊彼特教授精通英语，即便他没有像在处理那些较为棘手的问题时那样投入大量时间，他的个人风格也必然会在译文中留下印记。正因如此，以及前言中提到的其他原因，本书不仅仅是一部译作。

MY CHIEF aim has been to convey the meaning as accurately as possible, and to this end I have not hesitated to use a clumsy phrase in cases where there was no current English equivalent of the German word. After considerable reflection I decided upon “circular flow” for “Kreislauf,” for reasons which it would take too long to relate. There are inelegancies which have nothing to do with the technical side of translating. To eradicate these would have meant rewriting the whole, and it did not seem expedient to do so. Professor Schumpeter is so much at home in the English language that he would inevitably have left his mark on the translation even if he had not given his time as freely as he did to the more difficult points involved. For this reason, as well as for those mentioned in the preface, the book is more than a translation.

德文原版的标题是Theorie der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung。

The title of the German original is Theorie der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung.

R EDVERS O PIE

REDVERS OPIE

交易版简介

INTRODUCTION TO THE TRANSACTION EDITION

约翰·E·艾略特

JOHN E. ELLIOTT

我

I

约瑟夫·阿洛伊斯·熊彼特与他杰出的同代人、英国经济学家约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯一样，都出生于1883年，也就是卡尔·马克思逝世的那一年。他于1950年去世，比凯恩斯晚四年。因此，他的成年生活——以及他的出版著作——大致横跨了20世纪上半叶，正如马克思的生平横跨了​​19世纪中叶一样。熊彼特的老师欧根·冯·庞巴维克有时被称为“资产阶级马克思”，因为他专注于资本现象的研究，而资本正是马克思毕生核心著作的标题。但这个称号更适合熊彼特本人，许多学者认为，自马克思以来，他对工业化资本主义的经济发展和社会转型进行了最全面、最具启发性的分析。如果说马克思是熊彼特的劲敌，那么凯恩斯就是他同时代的竞争对手和反对者。熊彼特称马克思为十九世纪最伟大的社会科学家，因为他充满激情，视野开阔，对资本主义社会及其未来有着深刻的洞察，并且拥有将经济、社会和政治维度融会贯通的非凡能力。同样的评价也适用于熊彼特本人，他对资本主义发展和变革的分析同样融合了历史、经济和社会学要素，他对资本主义秩序及其前景的研究（除显著例外情况外）也提供了……索尔斯坦·凡勃伦的著作是二十世纪上半叶唯一真正全面地与凯恩斯的思想体系相抗衡的知识“体系”。

Joseph Alois Schumpeter, like his illustrious contemporary, British economist John Maynard Keynes, was born in 1883, the year of death of Karl Marx. He died in 1950, four years after Keynes. Thus, his adult life—and published works—roughly span the first half of the twentieth century, as Marx’s did the middle decades of the nineteenth. Schumpeter’s teacher, Eugen von Böhm-Bawerk, has sometimes been called the “bourgeois Marx,” because of his focus upon the phenomenon of capital, the title of Marx’s central lifework. The title better fits Schumpeter himself, who, many scholars believe, provided the most comprehensive and provocative analysis since Marx of the economic development and social transformation of industrializing capitalism. If Marx was Schumpeter’s worthy opponent, Keynes was his contemporary rival and antagonist. Schumpeter describes Marx as the greatest social scientist of the nineteenth century, because of the passion and breadth of his vision of capitalist society and its future and his uncanny ability to connect the economic, social, and political dimensions of his analysis. The same kind of comment can be made about Schumpeter, whose analysis of capitalist development and change similarly blends historical, economic, and sociological elements, and whose studies of the capitalist order and its prospects provide, with the notable exception of the writings of Thorstein Veblen, the only truly comprehensive rival intellectual “system” to that of Keynes in the first half of the twentieth century.

《经济发展理论》¹（本书即本书）生动地阐释了熊彼特关于智力创造力的一种珍视的诠释。在熊彼特看来，重要的创造性成就，尤其是理论成就，其基础几乎总是在学者生命的第三个十年奠定，即“神圣的灵感迸发的十年”。²他认为，随后的学术工作通常建立在这些基础之上，并充实早期创造性洞见的细节和应用。正如熊彼特在其对凯恩斯的评论文章中所述，任何全面的社会理论“都包含两个互补但本质上不同的要素。首先是理论家对社会状态基本特征的看法，即在特定时期理解社会生活时，哪些因素重要，哪些因素不重要。我们称之为他的愿景。其次是理论家的技巧，一种将愿景概念化并将其转化为具体命题或‘理论’的工具。” ³

The Theory of Economic Development,1 the work which comprises this book, vividly illustrates one of Schumpeter’s cherished interpretations concerning intellectual creativity. In Schumpeter’s view, the foundations of significant creative achievements, notably theoretical ones, are almost always laid in the third decade of a scholar’s life, “that decade of sacred fertility.”2 Subsequent scholarly work, he believed, typically builds on these foundations and fleshes out the details and applications of one’s early creative insight. As Schumpeter put it in his review essay on Keynes, every comprehensive theory of society “consists of two complementary but essentially distinct elements. There is, first, the theorist’s view about the basic features of that state of society, about what is and what is not important in order to understand its life at a given time. Let us call this his vision. And there is, second, the theorist’s technique, an apparatus by which he conceptualizes his vision and which turns the latter into concrete propositions or ‘theories.’”3

无论这种观点的总体优劣如何，它都与熊彼特的生活和学术工作非常契合。在他生命的第三个十年里，熊彼特以惊人的创造力迸发，生动地阐释了他的假设，建立了国际声誉，并为其毕生事业奠定了基础。熊彼特“从来都不是新手，而是一位早慧的天才；他进入科学领域时已是一位成熟的大师。” ⁴到31岁时，他已发表了20篇论文、50篇书评和3部主要著作。他的第一部著作《经济理论的本质和主要内容》（1908年）⁵精确而清晰地概述了交换经济的基本要素，至少从纯粹经济学的角度来看是如此。第二部著作《经济发展理论》（1911年）是如今的经典之作，使熊彼特享誉世界。它既展现了他对……的“愿景”，也阐述了……资本主义进程以及支撑他后续社会经济变革分析的核心理论结构。他的最后一部著作《学说与方法论史》（1914）对经济学的历史和方法论进行了简明扼要却又精辟的阐述。阿瑟·斯皮特利奥夫恰如其分地概括了熊彼特早期著作的独特之处，他问道：“一个25岁和27岁的年轻人撼动了这门学科的根基，这难道不令人闻所未闻吗？还是一个30岁的人撰写了经济学的历史？”

Whatever the general merits of this view, it fits closely the circumstances of Schumpeter’s life and scholarly work. In the third decade of his life, Schumpeter vividly illustrated his hypothesis by a remarkable burst of creative energy, the establishment of an international reputation, and the laying of the foundations for his life’s work. Schumpeter “was never a beginner but, a precocious genius; he entered the scientific arena a full-fledged master.”4 By the age of thirty-one, he had published twenty papers, fifty book reviews, and three major works. His first, The Essence and Principal Contents of Economic Theory (1908),5 outlined the basic elements of an exchange economy, at least from the perspective of pure economics, with precision and clarity. The second, The Theory of Economic Development (1911), was the now-classic work which made Schumpeter world-famous. It provided both his “vision” of the capitalist process and the central theoretical structure which underpinned his subsequent analysis of socioeconomic change. The last, Epochs in the History of Doctrine and Method (1914),6 gave a brief but brilliant exposition of the history and methodology of economics. Arthur Spietlioff aptly summaries the unusual character of Schumpeter’s early work by asking, “What is more unheard of, a twenty-five-year-old and a twenty-seven-year-old who stirs at the foundations of the discipline, or a thirty-year-old who writes its history?”7

熊彼特个性鲜明，人生经历丰富多彩，早年便崭露头角，这些都与他的创造力相得益彰。10岁时，他的母亲（几年前守寡）嫁给了奥匈帝国军队的一位中将，熊彼特从此在第一次世界大战前维也纳的贵族氛围中长大。1893年至1901年间，他的继父将他送入维也纳贵族子弟专属学校——特雷西亚努姆学院，为他提供了全面而古典的教育。离开特雷西亚努姆学院后，他进入维也纳大学法学院学习，专攻法律和经济学，并于1906年，年仅23岁时获得法学博士学位。三年后，在开罗从事律师工作并担任一位埃及公主的财务主管后，熊彼特被任命为奥匈帝国东部省份切尔诺维茨大学的正教授。 26岁时，熊彼特是格拉茨大学最年轻的正教授，他既是个桀骜不驯的天才，又是个不折不扣的“神童”。他鄙视大多数同事在他眼中过于保守的作风，喜欢穿着马靴参加教职工会议，甚至与妻子单独用餐时也穿着正式服装，以此来震惊他们。1911年，在他的老师兼恩人庞巴维克的帮助下，熊彼特被任命为格拉茨大学的教授。28岁时，他像在切尔诺维茨大学时一样，成为该校最年轻的正教授。然而，教职工们一致反对他的任命（戈特弗里德·哈伯勒评论说，他们推荐的是一个“地方无名之辈”），9他常年待在首都华盛顿的做法，并没有让他的学术同僚对他产生好感。三十岁时，他接受了哥伦比亚大学的客座教授职位，并于1914年被授予荣誉学位。

Schumpeter’s colorful personality, eventful life, and early recognition complemented his creativity. From the age of 10, when his mother, widowed several years earlier, married a lieutenant-general in the Austro-Hungarian army, Schumpeter grew up in the aristocratic atmosphere of pre-World War I Vienna. Between 1893 and 1901, he was provided by his step-father with a thorough and classical education at the Theresianum, an exclusive school for sons of the Viennese aristocracy. After leaving the Theresianum, he attended the University of Vienna as a student in the Faculty of Law, specializing in law and economics, and received the doctor of law degree in 1906, at twenty-three. Three years later, after practicing law in Cairo and managing the finances of an Egyptian princess, Schumpeter was appointed full professor at the University of Czernowitz, located in an eastern province of the Austro-Hungarian Empire. At twenty-six, the youngest full professor in the university, Schumpeter was a bit of an enfant terrible as well as a Wunderkind. Disdainful of what he perceived as the provinciality of most of his colleagues, he liked to shock them by wearing his riding boots at faculty meetings and formal dress even when dining alone with his wife.8 In 1911, with the help of his teacher and benefactor Böhm-Bawerk, Schumpeter was appointed to the faculty at the University of Graz. At twenty-eight, he was, as at Czernowitz, the youngest full professor in the university. This, combined with the solid negative vote of the faculty (who had recommended, Gottfried Haberler comments, some “local nonentity”)9 against his appointment, and his practice of spending much of his time in the national capital, did little to endear Schumpeter to his academic colleagues. At thirty, he accepted a visiting professorship at Columbia University, where he was awarded an honorary degree in 1914.

1914年至1925年间，熊彼特经历了一段非学术生涯，期间他短暂担任奥地利财政部长，但并不成功，之后又出任维也纳一家私人银行的总裁。1926年，熊彼特重返学术界，在波恩大学担任教授。20世纪30年代初，他访问日本并取得了巨大成功——他关于资本主义发展的著作在日本引起了不小的轰动——之后，他接受了哈佛大学的教职，并在那里任教直至1950年去世。关于熊彼特在哈佛任教期间的一个颇为有趣的故事，是他经常在课堂上引用的一句话：年轻时在维也纳，他有三个远大的抱负。一是成为维也纳最受女人欢迎的人；二是成为全欧洲最伟大的骑手；三是成为他那个时代最伟大的经济学家。可惜的是，熊彼特后来感叹，他只实现了这三个抱负中的两个。

Between 1914 and 1925, there was a nonacademic interlude which included a short and unsuccessful, stint as Austrian finance minister, followed by a presidency of a private bank in Vienna. Schumpeter returned to academic life in 1926 with a professorship at the University of Bonn. In the early 1930s, after a triumphal tour of Japan—where reception of his writings on capitalist development had created a minor sensation—he accepted a professorship at Harvard University and remained there until his death, in 1950. One of the more charming stories about Schumpeter during his Harvard period concerns his often-cited comment, in classes, that as a young man in Vienna he had three burning ambitions. One was to be the greatest lover of women in Vienna. The second was to be the greatest horseman in all Europe. The third was to be the greatest economist of his age. Alas, Schumpeter then would say, he had achieved only two of his three youthful ambitions.

二

II

要理解熊彼特的核心著作《经济发展理论》，需要将其置于更广阔的思想和历史背景中，并与其其他著作联系起来。经济思想的发展经历了三个伟大的创新时期。第一个时期大致从十八世纪末到十九世纪中叶，是古典政治经济学时期。这一时期涌现出亚当·斯密、托马斯·马尔萨斯、大卫·李嘉图和约翰·斯图亚特·穆勒等经典人物。此外，我们还应将卡尔·马克思也列入其中，他既扩展了古典经济学，又对其进行了批判性评价。这些人奠定了经济学作为一门系统性的社会科学学科的地位。尽管他们的方法和一些观点在后世经济学家看来略显粗糙，甚至有些误入歧途，但他们所处的时代却是经济学早期发展的一个黄金时期。他们中的大多数人关注经济增长与发展的宏大主题，关注社会经济变迁与社会阶层间收入和权力分配的关系，关注市场交换背后的生产和价值原则，同时也关注竞争性私营企业经济如何配置资源和销售产品等更为实际的问题。其中一些人既是哲学家又是社会科学家，而且大多数人对这门学科的理解足够宽泛，能够将经济行为与其社会和政治背景联系起来。

Understanding Schumpeter’s central work, The Theory of Economic Development, is enhanced by placing it in a broader intellectual and historical context and relating it to his other writings. There have been three great periods of creativity in the development of economic thought. The first, ranging from roughly the late eighteenth century to the middle decades of the nineteenth, was the era of classical politcal economy. This period was associated with such classic names as Adam Smith, Thomas Malthus, David Ricardo, and John Stuart Mill. To this list, we should add Karl Marx, who both extended and critically evaluated classical economic thought. These men established economics as a systematic, social scientific discipline. Although their methods and some of their ideas seemed crude, even misdirected, to later generations of economists, theirs was a kind of golden age in the early development of economics. Most of them were concerned with the grand themes of economic growth and development, the relation of socioeconomic change to the distribution of income and power among social classes, and to the principles of production and value underlying market exchange, as well as to the more mundane issues of how a competitive, private enterprise economy goes about allocating its resources and marketing its products. Several were philosophers as well as social scientists, and most perceived the discipline in sufficiently broad terms as to connect economic behavior to its social and political context.

经济思想的第二个伟大创造性时期出现在十九世纪后几十年。尽管这一时期与之前的古典时期一样，也有其先例，但公认的奠基人是一位英国人、一位法国人和一位奥地利人——斯坦利·杰文斯、莱昂·瓦尔拉斯和卡尔·门格尔。这三位经济学家各自独立地发表了一部重要的专著，标志着经济学在范围、内容和方法论上于19世纪70年代初发生了重大转变。 10 在这三位经济学家各自独立但又随着时间的推移而相互加强的领导下，经济学的关注点从经济发展和社会阶层间收入分配等宽泛的主题，转向了资源配置以及相关的个人收入分配等更为具体和易于处理的问题。时间框架也从动态的转变为明确的静态的，经济学这门学科也从规范性的转向了实证性的，这体现在从宽泛的“政治经济学”到更为具体的“经济学”的转变上。尽管门格尔和他的“奥地利学派”同事，如庞巴维克和弗里德里希·冯·维泽，都避开了数学，但在人们的认知中，数学却发挥了重要作用。杰文斯、瓦尔拉斯及其后继者认为，这种方法不适合探究经济数量的基本定性因素，因此他们强调需要对他们的研究对象进行定量研究，并强调数学对更精确的经济理论表述的贡献。

The second great creative period in economic thought occurred in the latter decades of the nineteenth century. Although this period, like the classical era before it, had its predecessors, its generally acknowledged founding figures were an Englishman, a Frenchman, and an Austrian—Stanley Jevons, Léon Walras, and Carl Menger. Each of these three independently published a major treatise embodying a significant shift in the scope, content, and methodology of economics during the early 1870s.10 Under the essentially separate, though with time reinforcing, leadership of this trio, the focus of economics shifted from the broad themes of economic development and distribution of income among social classes to the narrower and more manageable issues of the allocation of resources and the associated distribution of income among individuals. The time frame changed from the dynamic to the explicitly static, and the discipline became self-consciously positive rather than normative, symbolized by the shift from the broader phrase “political economy” to the narrower term “economics.” Although Menger and his “Austrian school” colleagues, Böhm-Bawerk and Friedrich A. von Wieser, eschewed mathematics, on the perceived ground that it was inappropriate for piercing the basic qualitative factors underlying economic quantities, Jevons, Walras, and their successors emphasized the need for a quantitative approach to their subject and to the contributions of mathematics to development of a more exact formulation of economic theories.

19世纪70年代的新经济学有时被称为“边际效用”学派。在这一新方法的早期阶段，人们更强调名词“效用”而非形容词“边际”，以此来区分新方法对市场交换价值中效用和需求等主观因素的关注，与早期古典经济学对生产成本和供给的强调形成对比。到了19世纪末，人们的关注点转向了形容词“边际”，因为这种以个体不同决策的增量收益和成本来衡量收益的“边际主义思维”逐渐渗透到对经济生活各个方面的解释中，例如美国边际经济学家约翰·贝茨·克拉克提出的边际生产力收入分配理论。根据克拉克的分析，在静态竞争均衡状态下，任何生产要素（例如“劳动力”或“土地”）的价格都等于其对总产出的边际贡献，而总产出将根据所有生产者的边际生产力进行分配，直至耗尽。

The new economics of the 1870s was sometimes called the “marginal utility” school. During the first generation of the new approach, emphasis was placed on the noun “utility” rather than the adjective “marginal,” to contrast the new focus upon subjective factors of utility and demand in determination of market exchange values with the earlier classical stress upon cost of production and supply. By the late nineteenth century, focus had shifted to the adjective, as the “marginalist way of thinking” in terms of incremental benefits and costs of alternative individual decisions spread to the interpretation of various aspects of economic life, illustrated, for example, by the marginal productivity theory of income distribution developed by the American marginalist John Bates Clark. According to Clark’s analysis, in static, competitive equilibrium, the price of any agent or factor of production such as “labor” or “land” would equal its marginal contribution to the total product produced, and the total product would be exhausted by payments to all individuals contributing to production in accord with their marginal productivities.

然而，如果只关注“边际效用”这一概念中的任何一个组成部分，都可能夸大了它与古典政治经济学的差异程度。两者之间重要的延续性体现在基本假设的本质相似性上，尤其是在动机、制度和技术方面。19世纪末的经济正统观念，如同其古典前辈一样，倾向于假定存在理性、精于算计的“经济学家”，他们致力于通过市场交换来促进个人经济利益。市场被认为本质上是……竞争激烈，由大量小型企业主导。人们认为技术足以支持这种原子式的竞争。事实上，企业规模的主要制约因素被认为是现有生产单位的“收益递减”和企业整体扩张的“规模不经济”，而非盈利性地销售更大产量的问题。另一个重要的延续性因素是普遍接受“萨伊定律”，该定律以19世纪早期法国经济学家让·巴蒂斯特·萨伊的名字命名。该定律假定，由于供求竞争市场交换过程的普遍良性运作，经济整体会自发地趋向于充分就业和资源利用的稳定均衡。

Focus upon either component in the phrase “marginal utility,” however, probably exaggerates the extent of differentiation from classical political economy. Important elements of continuity included essential similarities concerning underlying assumptions, notably concerning motivations, institutions, and technology. Economic orthodoxy of the late nineteenth century, like that of its classical predecessors, tended to suppose rational, calculating “economic men,” interested in promoting individual economic gain through market exchange. Markets were presumed to be essentially competitive, dominated by large numbers of small-scale enterprises. Technologies were assumed to permit atomistic competition. Indeed, the main constraint upon the size of enterprises was perceived to be “diminishing returns” to existing production units and “diseconomies to scale” to expansion in overall enterprise i.e., rather than problems in profitably marketing larger output. Another important element of continuity was the general acceptance of “Say’s law,” named in honor of early nineteenth-century French economist Jean Baptiste Say. This theorem postulated a tendency toward stable equilibrium at full employment and utilization of resources in the economy as a whole resulting spontaneously from the generally beneficial functioning of the competitive market exchange processes of supply and demand.

与杰文斯、瓦尔拉斯和门格尔相比，剑桥“新古典主义”经济学家阿尔弗雷德·马歇尔的著作与古典政治经济学的延续性要高得多。马歇尔的《经济学原理》出版后，历经八个版本，在1890年首次出版后的几十年里，一直主导着英语世界的经济学教学。马歇尔与边际效用学派的创始人一样，是一位彻底的边际主义者。与他们一样，他也独立地将效用和需求因素的战略作用纳入其交换价值分析中，尤其是在相对较短的时间周期内。他还与他们一样认为，“均衡”不仅意味着经济体系中每个个体都能获得最满意的处境，而且还意味着消除任何超常利润，即消除任何超出企业所有者对其自身生产资源贡献所需报酬的利润。然而，与他们不同的是，他通过在交换价值分析中纳入供给和成本因素的协同战略作用，尤其是在相对较长的时间跨度内，与古典政治经济学保持了明确的联系。他曾简要地预见了马歇尔之后的两项重大发展。通过观察经济分析可知，首先，卖家往往基于顾客忠诚度拥有一定程度的本地垄断地位，但试图将销售扩展到该市场之外则需要增加营销费用或降低价格；其次，与萨伊定律的顺利运行相反，尽管人们可能拥有消费能力（基于生产收入），但他们可能选择不行使这种能力。

Continuity with the classical political economy was substantially greater in the writings of the “neoclassical” Cambridge economist Alfred Marshall than was true for Jevons, Walras, and Menger. Marshall’s Principles of Economics, which went through eight editions, dominated economics teaching in the English-speaking world for several decades after its initial publication in 1890. Marshall was as thoroughgoing a marginalist as were the founders of the marginal utility school. Like them, he also independently incorporated a strategic role for utility and demand considerations in his analysis of exchange value, notably in relatively shorter periods of time. He also shared with them the view that “equilibrium” would involve not only the most satisfactory position for each individual in the economic system, but the elimination of any above-normal profits, that is, any profits above those necessary to reward the owner of an enterprise for the contributions of his own productive resources. Unlike them, however, he maintained an explicit linkage with classical political economy by incorporating a co-strategic role for supply and cost considerations in the analysis of exchange value, especially in relatively longer periods of time. He anticipated briefly two major post-Marshallian developments in economic analysis by observing, first, that sellers often have a degree of local monopoly based on customer loyalty, but that attempts to extend sales beyond that market would require enhanced marketing expenses or lower prices, and second, that, in contrast to a smooth working of Say’s law, though people may have the power to spend (based on income from production), they may choose not to exercise it.

无论是古典经济学还是新古典经济学，所谓经济思想的“中心传统”从未摆脱过批判。整个十九世纪，社会主义作家都批判资本主义市场经济容易导致不平等、工人阶级贫困、经济萧条和失业，以及资本主义雇主垄断和其他形式的权力。马克思及其后继者分析了资本主义发展和转型中的经济矛盾和社会冲突。历史经济学家反对正统经济学的演绎主义和非历史性方法。二十世纪初，凡勃伦和约翰·罗杰斯·康芒斯等美国制度主义者呼吁并部分地提供了对经济过程的分析，这些分析更加明确地认识到经济生活的技术、文化和心理框架，以及不断变化的社会制度结构对经济行为的影响。到了二十世纪初，新古典主义者自身也开始质疑其思想遗产中的某些方面。一个显著的例子是，人们对商业周期分析的兴趣日益浓厚，这主要由欧洲大陆经济学家推动，其中也包括一些主流经济学家。这项研究本身就挑战了萨伊定律这一由来已久的理论。相关学者包括俄国修正主义马克思主义者图甘-巴拉诺夫斯基、阿瑟·斯皮特霍夫（熊彼特后来在波恩的同事）、瑞典理论家克努特·维克塞尔和法国经济学家阿尔伯特·阿夫塔利翁等。

What may be called the “central tradition” in economic thought, whether in its classical or neoclassical form, was never free from critique. Throughout the nineteenth century, socialist writers criticized capitalist market economy for its proclivities toward inequality, working class poverty, depression and unemployment, and monopoly and other forms of power by capitalist employers. Marx and his successors analyzed economic contradictions and social conflicts in capitalist development and transformation. Historically oriented economists dissented from the deductivist and ahistorical methodology of orthodox economics. In the early decades of the twentieth century, American institutionalists such as Veblen and John Rogers Commons called for and partially provided analyses of the economic process that were more explicitly cognizant of the technological, cultural, and psychological framework of economic life, and of the impact to economic behavior upon the changing institutional structure of society. By the early twentieth century, neoclassicists themselves were beginning to challenge selected aspects of their intellectual heritage. A prominent example was expanding interest in analysis of business cycles, largely by continental economists, including some mainstream writers, an enterprise which by its very nature challenges the hoary proposition of Say’s law. Contributors included, among others, the Russian revisionist Marxist Tugan-Baranowsky, Arthur Spiethoff (Schumpeter’s later colleague at Bonn), the Swedish theorist Knut Wicksell, and the French economist Albert Aftalion.

到20世纪20年代中期，人们对现状的不满情绪日益高涨。经济学实践者的工作、不断变化的技术和制度结构，以及世界大战、革命和战后经济动荡带来的冲击，共同营造了一种有利于思想创新的氛围。1940年之前的十五年可被视为经济思想发展史上的第三个伟大创造性时期。这些“艰难时期”也是“理论高度发达”的时期。 11这一时期始于皮耶罗·斯拉法 (Piero Sraffa) 于1926年发表的一篇开创性文章，该文章呼吁围绕垄断而非竞争的概念重建经济分析。 12 随后，琼·罗宾逊 (Joan Robinson) 和爱德华·张伯伦 (Edward Chamberlin) 发表了关于市场结构的重要著作， 13 约翰·R·希克斯 (John R. Hicks) 发表了关于价值和资本的著作， 14 约翰·R ·康芒斯 (John R. Commons) 发表了关于资本主义的法律和制度基础的著作， 15而最引人注目的是约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯 (John Maynard Keynes) 的关于货币和就业的著作。16这一时期恰逢熊彼特的第二次著作大量涌现，他扩展、完善并发展了其1908-1914年早期德文著作的内涵。《经济发展理论》第二版德文版于1926年出版，英文译本于1934年出版。随后，熊彼特于1939年出版了其鸿篇巨制——两卷本的《商业周期》 17 ，并于1942年出版了其极具争议且广为流传的《资本主义、社会主义与民主》 18 。这一时期大量发表的文章和评论聚焦于资本主义发展和转型的动态特性 19 。

By the mid-1920s, dissatisfaction with the current state of economics by its practitioners, changing technological and institutional structure, and the shocks of world war, revolution, and postwar economic dislocations combined to create an atmosphere receptive to intellectual innovation. The decade and a half ending in 1940 may be characterized as the third great creative period in the development of economic thought. These years of “hard times” were also ones of “high theory.”11 They commenced with a seminal article calling for the reconstruction of economic analysis around the concept of monopoly instead of competition, by Piero Sraffa in 1926,12 and continued with the publication of major works on market structure by Joan Robinson and Edward Chamberlin,13 on value and capital by John R. Hicks,14 on legal and institutional foundations of capitalism by John R. Commons,15 and, most compellingly, on money and employment by John Maynard Keynes.16 This period coincided with a second great outpouring of writings from Schumpeter, who extended, refined, and developed the implications of his early German work of 1908-14. The second German edition of The Theory of Economic Development appeared in 1926. Its English translation was published in 1934. This was followed by the publication, in 1939, of Schumpeter’s monumental two-volume study, Business Cycles,17 and, in 1942, of his provocative and widely-read Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy.18 The steady stream of articles and reviews written during this period focused on the dynamic properties of capitalist development and transformation.19

三

III

如果我们现在问：“ 《经济发展》一书中表达的主要思想是什么？它们如何反映经济思想三大伟大创造时期所产生的观点？”，我们的答案首先要指出的是，熊彼特是一位兼具博学和创新精神的思想家。这一点在其著作的结构中得到了鲜明的体现。熊彼特的开创性著作，即他将经济过程划分为“三种不同的类别：循环流动过程、发展过程以及阻碍后者顺利进行的过程”[218] 。20

If we now ask, “What are the salient ideas expressed in Economic Development and how do they reflect the perspectives emanating from these three great creative periods in economic thought?”, our answer commences with the observation that Schumpeter was a special blend of eclectic and innovator. This is illustrated pointedly by the very structure of Schumpeter’s seminal work, that is, by his division of economic processes “into three different classes: into the processes of the circular flow, into those of development, and into those which impede the latter’s undisturbed course” [218].20

1. “受既定环境制约的经济生活循环流动”[3]，几乎每一本当代基础经济学教科书的开篇章节都有描述，这是熊彼特对经济变量和现象在稳定条件下相互关系的一般均衡系统的表述。21

1. The “circular flow of economic life as conditioned by given circumstances” [3], described in the early chapters of virtually every contemporary textbook on basic economics, was Schumpeter’s expression for a general equilibrium system of mutual interrelations among economic variables and phenomena under stationary conditions.21

熊彼特认为，在缺乏经济发展的情况下，竞争性资本主义经济会趋于稳定，最终进入一般均衡的循环流动状态。产品和资源市场上的需求将与供给相匹配，个人在既定的市场价格下会调整其需求量和供给量，直至在个体均衡状态下实现经济收益最大化。资源将根据主权消费者的市场偏好进行配置。收入将根据土地和劳动力这两种基本资源的边际产出的市场价值进行分配，以租金和工资的形式体现（资本分解为土地和劳动力）。竞争和信贷的平等获取将消除所有“剩余价值”，从而消除纯粹的经济利润以及生产性、盈利性投资所产生的利息收入。货币、商品、劳动力和金融资产市场的均衡将确保充分就业和经济稳定。由于经济的稳定性和确定性（除了偏好和资源供给的边际变化及其带来的调整），货币的“价值储存”功能将会减弱，商业银行通过信贷创造产生的新货币也将消失。经济将沿着一条稳定的均衡增长路径运行，这条路径由劳动力、储蓄和资本积累的缓慢而渐进的增长决定。这种边际……单纯的经济数量扩张将“不会导致任何质的新现象，而只会带来适应过程……”[63]，类似于适应消费者口味变化和其他外部数据的过程。

In the absence of economic development, the competitive capitalist economy, Schumpeter held, would tend to settle into the routine of the circular flow in stationary general equilibrium. Demands would match supplies on product and resource markets, and individuals, given market prices, would adjust their quantities demanded and supplied until they had maximized their economic gain in positions of individual equilibrium. Resources would be allocated according to the market-revealed preferences of sovereign consumers. Income would be distributed according to the market value of the marginal product of the two basic resources, land and labor, in the form of rents and wages (capital being resolved into land and labor). Competition and equal credit availability would eliminate all “surplus values” and, thereby, both pure economic profits and the interest income derived from productive, profitable investment.22 Equilibrium, in markets for money, goods, labor, and financial assets, would assure full employment and economic stability. Because of stability and the certainty associated with a stationary economy (except for marginal changes in tastes and resource supplies, and resulting adjustments), the “store of value” function of money would atrophy and new money through credit creation by commercial banks would disappear. The economy would move along a stable equilibrium path of economic growth, determined by small and gradual increases in the labor force, savings, and capital accumulation. Such marginal and mere quantitative economic expansion would entail “no qualitatively new phenomena, but only processes of adaptation …” [63] similar to those of adjusting to changes in consumer tastes and other external data.

在这种一般均衡系统中，除了消费者可以被称为“领导者”之外，不会有领导者、管理者或发起者。商人将被动地对市场需求和成本状况做出反应，以常规的方式将土地和劳动力结合起来，除了监督之外不做任何特殊贡献，并且除了工资和租金（作为其自身劳动服务和土地使用权的报酬）之外，不获得任何特殊收入。

In such a general equilibrium system, there would be no leaders, directors, or initiators, except insofar as consumers could be termed “leaders.” Businessmen would react passively to market demand and cost conditions, combining land and labor in a routinized fashion, making no special contributions other than that of superintendence, and receiving no special income beyond wages and rents for their own labor services and use of land.

在阐述这一论点时，熊彼特借鉴了奥地利学派和边际主义先驱的思想，包括“美国奥地利学派”约翰·贝茨·克拉克 23，以及他（及其老师庞巴维克）的思想偶像莱昂·瓦尔拉斯 24的理论形式。在《经济发展》第一章中，穿插着对奥地利学派创始人卡尔·门格尔以及他在维也纳大学的三位老师——庞巴维克、菲利普维奇和维泽——的引用。诸如将商品分类为“低级”（消费）和“高级”（生产资料，最终包括劳动力和土地）、归算、机会成本以及成本与收益相等等基本概念，都明显源于奥地利学派。经济过程“自动同步”[38]的观点，即无需“等待”未来的收入流来抵消当前成本，是克拉克早期分析的一种变体，正如劳动力和土地所有者根据其“边际生产力”获得收入的概念一样。瓦尔拉斯的理论也大量借鉴于此，尤其体现在企业家处于稳定均衡状态的概念[ 25] 、家庭和企业之间的相互依存关系以及它们之间产品和资源支出的流动，以及趋向均衡的趋势等方面。

In presenting this argument, Schumpeter drew upon the content of his Austrian and marginalist forebears, including the “American Austrian,” John Bates Clark,23 and the form of his (and that of his teacher, Böhm-Bawerk) intellectual hero, Léon Walras.24 References to Carl Menger, the founder of the Austrian school, and to Böhm-Bawerk, Philippovich, and Wieser, three of his teachers at the University of Vienna, are interspersed throughout the first chapter of Economic Development. Such basic concepts as classification of goods into those of “lower order” (consumption) and “higher order” (produced means of production and, ultimately, labor and land), imputation, opportunity costs, and equality of costs and revenues all have clear Austrian antecedents. The notion that the economic process is “automatically synchronized” [38], in the sense that “waiting” for a future flow of revenues to offset current costs is unnecessary, is a variant of Clark’s earlier analysis, as is the concept that owners of labor and land receive incomes according to their “marginal productivity.” Debts to Walras also abound, notably in the concept of the entrepreneur in stationary equilibrium,25 the mutual interdependence between households and business firms and the flows of expenditures between them for products and resources, and the tendency toward equilibrium.

尽管熊彼特大量借鉴了他……的著作在构建循环流动概念的过程中，熊彼特借鉴了前人和同时代学者的研究成果，他对这一最基本的经济过程的分析展现出方法论上的独立性和创造性的洞察力。对于熊彼特的同代人来说，在静态和稳定条件下对资源配置和收入分配的分析具有逻辑分析、描述和/或规范的目的。像路德维希·冯·米塞斯（1905-06年与熊彼特在维也纳参加庞巴维克的研讨会）和弗里德里希·冯·哈耶克这样的“新奥地利学派”学者，从哈耶克后来称之为“纯粹选择逻辑”的角度来理解循环流动，认为它是由竞争性市场过程协调的。英国新古典主义经济学家阿尔弗雷德·马歇尔希望他对基本经济过程的分析至少能够粗略地描述现实世界的现象。J·B·克拉克认为，根据边际生产率进行收入分配在道德上是公正的，在经验上也是相关的。维尔弗雷多·帕累托是瓦尔拉斯在洛桑大学经济学教席的继任者，他认为一般均衡是一种最大程度满足的状态，也就是说，任何经济主体的境况都不可能在不损害其他经济主体的境况的情况下得到改善。 27

Although Schumpeter drew freely from the writings of his predecessors and contemporaries in constructing his conception of the circular flow, his analysis of even this most basic economic process showed both methodological independence and creative insight. For Schumpeter’s contemporaries, analysis of resource allocation and income distribution under static and stationary conditions had a logically analytic, a descriptive, and/or a prescriptive purpose. Such “neo-Austrians” as Ludwig von Mises (a contemporary of Schumpeter’s in Böhm-Bawerk’s seminars at Vienna in 1905-06) and Friedrich von Hayek perceived the circular flow in terms of what Hayek later called the “pure logic of choice,” as coordinated by competitive market processes.26 British neoclassicist Alfred Marshall intended his analyses of basic economic processes to be at least roughly descriptive of real-world phenomena. J.B. Clark believed that distribution of income in accordance with marginal productivity was morally just as well as empirically relevant. Vilfredo Pareto, successor to Walras’s chair in economics at the University of Lausanne, perceived general equilibrium as a state of maximum satisfaction, in the sense that no economic agent could be made better off without another being made worse off.27

熊彼特并未否认一般均衡概念在平稳条件下的分析价值。他也认为它具有一定的经验意义。正如他后来所说，可以“区分出系统偏离均衡的特定时期，以及系统趋向均衡的特定时期”。因此，存在着一些“邻域”，在这些邻域中，均衡条件近似得到满足。 28然而，“理解资本主义的关键在于”，它是一个“演化过程”，正如“卡尔·马克思很久以前就强调的那样”。资本主义“本质上是一种经济变革的形式或方法，它不仅从来不是，而且永远不可能是静止的”。 29因此，熊彼特对循环流的更深层次的分析并非旨在描述性的。或者说，它不具有规范性；也就是说，它既不能准确描述实际的资本主义经济，也不能为评估资本主义经济绩效提供规范性基准。 30 相反，它构成了一个有用的思维实验，即：如果经济发展中那些动态的、革命性的变化不存在，资本主义市场经济会是什么样子？熊彼特正是基于循环流动模型的推论——即从明确的动态和演化视角来解释现实世界经济生活的脉动过程——来论证该模型的严谨性。 31

Schumpeter did not deny the analytical usefulness of the general equilibrium concept under stationary conditions. He also believed it had some empirical significance. As he later put it, it is possible “to distinguish definite periods in which the system embarks upon an excursion away from equilibrium and equally definite periods in which it draws toward equilibrium.” There are thus “neighborhoods” in which equilibrium conditions are approximately fulfilled.28 The “essential point to grasp about capitalism,” however, is that it is an “evolutionary process,” as “was long ago emphasized by Karl Marx.” Capitalism is “by nature a form or method of economic change and, not only never is, but never can be stationary.”29 Consequently, Schumpeter’s analysis of the circular flow in a deeper sense is not intended to be either descriptive or prescriptive; that is, it neither accurately describes actual capitalist economies nor provides normative benchmarks for evaluation of capitalist economic performance.30 Instead, it constitutes a useful mental experiment by asking what a capitalist market economy would be like if the dynamic, revolutionary changes of economic development were absent. The very austerity of the circular flow model is justified by Schumpeter on the suggestive ground of its corollary implication that the pulsating processes of real-world economic life are better explained from an explicitly dynamic and evolutionary perspective.31

2. 与循环流动的静态过程不同，熊彼特的经济发展概念（第二章）具有三个显著特征：它源于经济系统内部，而不仅仅是对外部数据变化的适应；它是间断性的，而非平滑的；它带来质的变化或“革命”，从根本上打破旧的均衡，创造全新的条件。经济发展伴随着增长，即国民收入、储蓄和人口的持续增长。但单纯的数量增长并不等同于发展：“无论你增加多少邮车，”熊彼特说，“你永远也建不成铁路”[64n]。

2. In contrast to the stationary processes of the circular flow, Schumpeter’s concept of economic development (chapter 2) has three salient characteristics: it comes from within the economic system and is not merely an adaptation to changes in external data; it occurs discontinuously, rather than smoothly; it brings qualitative changes or “revolutions,” which fundamentally displace old equilibria and create radically new conditions. Economic development is accompanied by growth, that is, by a sustained upward movement in national income, saving, and population. But mere quantitative growth does not constitute development: “Add successively as many mail coaches as you please,” said Schumpeter, “you will never get a railway thereby” [64n].

在熊彼特的分析中，经济发展的战略刺激因素是创新，创新被定义为将新事物——新产品、新工艺或新生产方法；新市场或供应来源；新形式的商业、企业或金融机构——应用于商业或工业领域。 32例如，资本主义工业化历史上的伟大创新，如19世纪铁路化和20世纪汽车发展等，通常都源于经济的商业和工业部门，而非古典和新古典经济理论中的“主权消费者”。创新过程，熊彼特随后指出，“资本主义不断地从内部革新经济结构，不断地摧毁旧的结构，不断地创造新的结构。这种创造性破坏的过程是资本主义的本质特征。” 33

The strategic stimulus to economic development in Schumpeter’s analysis is innovation, defined as the commercial or industrial application of something new—a new product, process, or method of production; a new market or source of supply; a new form of commercial, business, or financial organization.32 The great innovations in the history of capitalist industrialization, for example, those associated with railroadization in the nineteenth century and the development of the automobile in the twentieth, typically have emerged from the commercial and industrial sectors of the economy, not from the “sovereign consumer” of classical and neoclassical economic theory. The innovational process, Schumpeter subsequently observed, “incessantly revolutionizes the economic structure from within, incessantly destroying the old one, incessantly creating a new one. This process of Creative Destruction is the essential fact about capitalism.”33

新理念的商业应用，通常涉及现有生产资料的购置和重新利用，必须获得资金支持。而仅靠既定循环经济中的收入无法为其提供资金，因为这些收入仅够支付现有成本和折旧。对于大胆的创新尝试，尤其是当这些新理念（通常情况下）需要超出替换需求的新增净投资时，这些收入既不足以支付，也难以获得。因此，无论从逻辑上还是历史角度来看，创新都必须通过寻求循环经济之外的信贷来源来筹集资金，即商业银行。商业银行是资本主义经济中唯一拥有创造新货币（即利用现有收入创造高于现有储蓄的购买力）独特权力的私人金融机构。

The commercial application of a new idea, often involving the acquisition and redirection of the employment of existing means of production, must be financed. It cannot be financed from the revenues received in the stationary circular flow, because these are just sufficient to cover existing costs and depreciation. They are not sufficient and not generally available for the daring experiments involved in shifting to new ways of doing things, especially when these new ideas involve (as they customarily do) new net investment beyond replacement requirements. Innovations, both logically and historically, must be financed by turning to a source of credit above and beyond the circular flow, namely, the commercial bank, the only private financial institution in the capitalist economy with the unique power to create new money, new purchasing power above current saving out of current income.

因此，创新与创新的融资方式截然不同，创新者或“企业家”也与资本家——“货币、货币债权或物质商品的拥有者”[75]——有所区别，即便他们碰巧是同一人。创新者必须说服资本家，其创新带来的更高收益和/或更低成本将使其能够偿还贷款的本金和利息。创新者必须确信，预期从创新中获得的利润足以偿还贷款本金和利息，并最终获得净利润。因此，信贷创造是资本主义经济中经济发展的必要条件，但并非充分条件。

Innovation thus is distinguishable from the financing of the innovation, and the innovator or “entrepreneur” is distinguishable from the capitalist “owners of money, claims to money, or material goods” [75], even when, coincidentally, they are the same person. The innovator-entrepreneur must convince the capitalist that the higher revenues and/or lower costs stemming from his innovation will enable him to pay both principal and interest on the loan. The innovator must convince himself that the profits expected from the innovation will be sufficient to do this and leave a net profit for him. Thus, credit creation is a necessary but not, by itself, sufficient condition for economic development in a capitalist economy.

在资本主义经济中，资本家向企业家提供信贷以资助创新是一项至关重要的功能。的确，“重要到足以作为其具体区分特征”[69]。但熊彼特认为，经济发展的关键在于“新组合的实施”，即企业家将新理念付诸实践。企业家不仅区别于发明家和资本家，也区别于商业经理人。企业家精神比商业管理更广义，因为并非所有企业家都经营着成熟的企业；它又比商业管理更狭义，因为并非所有沉浸于循环流程日常计算的管理者都会从事企业家活动，即创新。

The provision of credit by capitalists to entrepreneurs to finance innovations is a vital function in a capitalist economy, indeed, “important enough to serve as its differentia specified” [69]. But the linchpin of economic development, according to Schumpeter, is the “carrying out of new combinations,” the putting into practice of the new ideas by entrepreneurs. Entrepreneurs are distinguishable not only from inventors and capitalists, but from businessmen-managers as well. Entrepreneurship is broader than business management because not all entrepreneurs operate established businesses. It is narrower than business management because not all managers, immersed as they are in the routine calculations of the circular flow, engage in entrepreneurial activities, that is, innovations.

熊彼特认为，创新面临着巨大的困难。首先，企业家决策所需的知识存在于循环流动的已知准确数据之外，因此充满不确定性。其次，客观的不确定性因个人不愿涉足未知领域的心理而加剧。第三，非创新者对先驱者的抵触情绪——这种抵触情绪体现在法律和政治障碍、社会风俗习惯等等方面。

Innovation faces immense difficulties, Schumpeter contends. First, the knowledge necessary for entrepreneurial decisions lies outside the known and accurate data of the circular flow and thus is shrouded in uncertainty. Second, objective uncertainty is compounded by subjective reluctance of individuals to strike out into the unknown. Third is the antagonism of non-innovators to the pioneer—in the form of legal arid political obstacles, social mores, customs, and the like.

克服这些困难需要一种特殊的人。与“经济学家”不同，后者会根据已知数据仔细计算各种行动方案的边际成本和收益，企业家必须是一位“有远见”、敢于冒险的人，愿意承担风险，凭借直觉，采取与既定循环模式截然相反的行动方案。企业家与其说是一位“经济学家”，不如说是一位“英雄”：他必须拥有“建立私人王国”的动力和意志，成为“行业领袖”；拥有“征服的意志”，为了战斗本身而战，而不仅仅是为了战斗带来的经济利益；渴望创造新事物——即使这意味着摧毁旧的思维和行动模式。熊彼特指出，在任何社会，包括资本主义社会，这样的人都是少数。

It takes a special kind of person to overcome these difficulties. In contrast to the “economic man,” who carefully calculates marginal costs and revenues of alternative courses of action on the basis of known data, the entrepreneur must be a man of “vision,” of daring, willing to take chances, to strike out, largely on the basis of intuition, on courses of action in direct opposition to the established, settled patterns of the circular flow. The entrepreneur is more of a “heroic” than an “economic” figure: he must have “the drive and the will to found a private kingdom” as a “captain of industry”; the “will to conquer,” to fight for the sake of the fight rather than simply the financial gains of the combat; the desire to create new things—even at the expense of destroying old patterns of thought and action.34 In any society, including capitalism, said Schumpeter, such people are in the minority.

熊彼特对静止循环流和发展过程的鲜明区分，或许无意中掩盖了他明显受到更传统的前辈和同时代学者的影响。庞巴维克著名的论断——“迂回的生产方式”（即生产资源初始投资与最终产出之间“孕育期”较长的生产方式）“比直接生产方式更能取得更好的成果” 35 ——与熊彼特的观点不谋而合，熊彼特认为“采用迂回的生产方式……将是一种企业家行为——是我所构想的实施新组合的众多子案例之一”[159]。熊彼特对单纯经济增长和真正经济发展的区分，与瓦尔拉斯早期对“经济进步”和“技术进步”的区分如出一辙。36熊彼特明确赞扬了 JB Clark 的早期工作，尤其是在《经济理论要义》（1907 年）中，“其优点在于有意识地将‘静态’和‘动态’分开”，并且像熊彼特一样，“在动态因素中看到了静态均衡的扰动”[60n]。

Schumpeter’s sharp distinction between the stationary circular flow and the developmental process may inadvertently obfuscate his recognized intellectual debts to more conventional predecessors and contemporaries. Böhm-Bawerk’s famous argument that “roundabout methods” of production (that is, methods involving longer “gestation” periods between initial investment of productive resources and final appearance of outputs) “lead to greater results than direct methods”35 has its counterpart in Schumpeter’s observation that “adoption of roundabout methods of production … would be an entrepreneurial act—one of the many subordinate cases of my concept of carrying out new combinations” [159]. Schumpeter’s distinction between mere economic growth and genuine economic development parallels Walras’s earlier one between “economic progress” and “technical progress.”36 Schumpeter expressly commended the earlier work of J.B. Clark, notably in The Essentials of Economic Theory (1907), “whose merit is in having consciously separated ‘statics’ and ‘dynamics’” and who, like Schumpeter, “saw in the dynamic elements a disturbance of the static equilibrium” [60n].

与庞巴维克和瓦尔拉斯不同，“熊彼特的伟大贡献在于，他将企业家的角色置于首位，并清晰地指出该体系与均衡体系之间的根本区别，从而使该体系充满活力。” 37熊彼特的分析在三个主要方面区别于克拉克的分析，并对其进行了改进。首先，克拉克将经济变革的五大来源归为一类：资本增加、人口增加、消费者偏好变化、技术进步和生产组织变革。在熊彼特更为严谨的表述中，前两项被认为仅仅是指数量扩张或经济增长。第三项涉及循环流组成的变化，其本身并不需要特殊的动态理论框架。然而，后两项，这些都是经济发展这一定性现象的突出例证，它远不止是均衡的扰动。其次，根据熊彼特的观点，基本的经济现象依赖于经济发展过程，并深受其影响，尤其是信贷和资本、利润和利息。因此，对熊彼特而言，经济发展理论并非仅仅是经济分析核心的附属品或附录，而是重新诠释大多数经济过程的基础。在传统的主流经济学中，这些经济过程往往被置于静态和稳定的总体均衡框架内进行考察。这些主题在《经济发展》一书的第三、四、五章中得到了详尽的探讨。

In contrast to Böhm-Bawerk and Walras, “Schumpeter’s great contribution lies in dynamising the system by putting the role of [the] entrepreneur in the forefront and clearly indicating the fundamental differences between this system and the system of equilibrium.”37 Schumpeter’s analysis is differentiated from and an improvement upon Clark’s in three major ways. First, Clark places in one overall category five sources of economic change: increases in capital, increases in population, changes in the direction of consumers’ tastes, improvements in technique, and changes in productive organization. In Schumpeter’s more exacting formulation, the first two are perceived to evoke mere quantitative expansion or economic growth. The third pertains to a change in the composition of the circular flow, and in itself requires no special dynamic theoretical framework. The last two, however, are prominent examples of the qualitative phenomenon of economic development, which goes substantially beyond mere disturbance of equilibrium. Second, according to Schumpeter, essential economic phenomena depend upon and are profoundly affected by the process of economic development, notably, credit and capital, profit, and interest. Thus, for Schumpeter, the theory of economic development is not a mere adjunct or appendix to the central body of economic analysis, but the foundation for a reinterpretation of most of the economic processes which, in conventional mainstream economics, are considered within the constraining framework of static and stationary general equilibrium. These topics are examined in great detail in chapters 3, 4, and 5 of Economic Development.

克拉克和熊彼特的经济发展观之间存在第三个区别，这一点可以通过参考马克思的观点来加以说明。克拉克将他提出的五种经济变革来源视为影响经济过程的“外部数据”。在熊彼特看来，这种观点忽略了技术和生产组织方式的变革“需要特殊的分析，并且与理论意义上的[单纯的]扰动截然不同。未能认识到这一点，正是经济理论中存在诸多不足的最重要原因。正是从这个看似微不足道的来源中……涌现出一种新的经济过程观”[60n]。

There is a third difference between Clark’s and Schumpeter’s conception of economic development which may be highlighted by reference to Karl Marx. Clark regarded his five sources of economic change as “external data” that impinge upon economic processes. In Schumpeter’s view, this fails to recognize that changes in technique and productive organization “require special analysis and evoke something different again from [mere] disturbances in the theoretical sense. The non-recognition of this is the most important single reason for what appears unsatisfactory to us in economic theory. From this insignificant-looking source flows … a new conception of the economic process” [60n].

熊彼特继续说道，这种新观念“更接近马克思的观点。因为根据马克思的说法，经济发展是一个内在的过程，而不仅仅是经济生活对变化数据的适应”[60n]。熊彼特在《经济发展》日文版的序言中详细阐述了这一点。他在序言中指出，他的著作旨在“构建一个关于经济随时间变化过程的理论模型，或者更确切地说，回答经济系统如何产生不断改变自身的动力这一问题。” 38与诸如……的经济学家相比，瓦尔拉斯和克拉克认为，熊彼特相信“经济体系内部存在一种能量源，这种能量本身就会破坏任何可能达到的均衡。如果真是如此，那么就必须存在一种纯粹的经济理论来解释经济变革，而不能仅仅依赖于外部因素推动经济体系从一个均衡状态过渡到另一个均衡状态。”如今，“这一理念和目标与卡尔·马克思经济学理论的理念和目标完全相同。事实上，马克思区别于他同时代以及之前的经济学家的，正是他对经济演化的独特理解，即经济演化是由经济体系自身产生的。” 39

This new conception, Schumpeter continues, “is more nearly parallel to that of Marx. For according to him there is an internal economic development and no mere adaption of economic life to changing data” [60n]. Schumpeter elaborated on this point in the preface to the Japanese edition of Economic Development. The aim of his work, he there observes, was to “construct a theoretic model of the process of economic change in time, or perhaps more clearly, to answer the question how the economic system generates the force which incessantly transforms it.”38 In contrast to economists like Walras and Clark, Schumpeter believed there was “a source of energy within the economic system which would of itself disrupt any equilibrium that might be attained. If this is so, then there must be a purely economic theory of economic change which does not merely rely on external factors propelling the economic system from one equilibrium to another.” Now, “this idea and aim are exactly the same as the idea and the aim which underlay the economic teaching of Karl Marx. In fact, what distinguished him from the economists of his own time and those who preceded him, was precisely a vision of economic evolution as a distinct process generated by the economic system itself.”39

当然，马克思和熊彼特的著作中对资本主义发展和转型这一内在动力机制的分析既有相似之处，也有不同之处。其中一个不同之处在于，熊彼特对静止经济过程的构想忽略了资本家和企业家，而马克思的构想（他称之为“简单再生产”）则忽略了资本积累。因此，马克思对静止资本主义的分析明确地指出了基于财产和财富的社会权力和阶级关系，而熊彼特的论证中则缺乏这一点。由此推论，对熊彼特而言，企业家创新是经济发展的核心自主原因，而资本积累则是其主要结果。相比之下，对马克思而言，资本积累本身才是发展过程中的主要动力。

Of course, the analyses of the character of this internally-generated dynamic of capitalist development and transformation found in the works of Marx and Schumpeter show both similarities and differences. One difference is that whereas Schumpeter’s conception of the stationary economic process abstracts from both the capitalist and the entrepreneur, Marx’s conception (which he called “simple reproduction”) abstracts from capital accumulation. Consequently, Marx’s analysis of stationary capitalism includes an express identification of social power and class relations based upon property and wealth that is missing from Schumpeter’s argument. As a corollary, entrepreneurial innovation is, for Schumpeter, the central autonomous cause of economic development, and capital accumulation is a major result. For Marx, by contrast, capital accumulation is itself the primary force in the development process.

然而，这种差异不应被夸大。首先，企业家精神和创新是马克思对资本积累过程分析的关键要素。其次，在熊彼特的分析中，成功的企业家最终会成为资本家。此外，在资本主义的后期阶段，正如马克思所论证的那样，创新日益成为富裕的成熟企业的事务，而不是新兴工业“雇佣兵”的事务。 40 第三，熊彼特强调，他的理论“结构仅涵盖了马克思理论的一小部分”。基础”[60n]。具体而言，熊彼特在其《经济发展》第二版中回应了对其第一版的批评，这些批评指责他忽略了除个体企业家精神之外的所有“历史变革因素”[61n]。41熊彼特坚持认为，恰恰相反，《经济发展》“根本不关注具体的变革因素，而是关注这些因素发挥作用的方式，关注变革的机制。 ‘企业家’仅仅是这一机制的载体。而且，我没有考虑任何历史变革因素”[61n]。

This difference, however, should not be exaggerated. First entrepreneurship and innovation are key elements in Marx’s analysis of the capital accumulation process. Second, successful entrepreneurs become capitalists in Schumpeter’s analysis. Moreover, in the later stages of capitalism, innovation increasingly becomes the business, as in Marx’s argument, of wealthy established enterprises rather than new industrial soldiers of fortune.40 Third, Schumpeter emphasizes that his theoretical “structure covers only a small part of [Marx’s] ground” [60n]. Specifically, in his second edition of Economic Development, Schumpeter responded to critics of his first edition who had alleged that he had neglected all “historical factors of change” [61n] except individual entrepreneurship.41 To the contrary, insisted Schumpeter, Economic Development “is not at all concerned with the concrete factors of change, but with the method by which these work, with the mechanism of change. The ‘entrepreneur’ is merely the bearer of the mechanism. And I have taken account not of one factor of historical change, but of none” [61n].

3.要更好地理解《经济发展》最后一章关于商业周期的内容，需要将其置于他后来于1939年出版的关于此主题的两卷本巨著的语境中。熊彼特对商业周期的重视程度，可以从这部后来的著作的副标题—— 《商业周期：资本主义过程的理论、历史和统计分析》——中看出。 42在这本书中，熊彼特区分了研究周期性波动的三个“近似”或阶段。第一个近似本质上就是《经济发展》最后一章的内容，该章节在第二版中进行了大幅修改。尽管这一基本模型抽象化了周期性变化的许多具体特征，但熊彼特认为它很有用，因为正如他在1939年所说，它剔除了“无数次要的、偶然的、偶然的以及‘外部的’事实和反应”，而这些事实和反应“覆盖了经济生活的骨架，有时甚至将其完全掩盖”。 43第二个近似模型在《经济发展》一书中简要描述，并在他后来的著作中得到了更全面的阐述。该模型纳入了商业周期的补充性、复杂化特征，在潜在的“主波”之上产生了“次级波”。第三个近似模型在1934年《经济发展》英文版的序言中有所提及，并在他1939年的研究中得到发展。该模型区分了不同长度和振幅的周期。

3. The concluding chapter of Economic Development, on business cycles, can be better appreciated by placing it in the context of his later, magisterial two-volume study on this subject in 1939. The importance which Schumpeter attached to business cycles can be better appreciated by noting the subtitle of this later work: Business Cycles: A Theoretical, Historical and Statistical Analysis of the Capitalist Process.42 In this book, Schumpeter distinguishes among three “approximations” or stages in the study of cyclical fluctuations. The first approximation is essentially that found in the concluding chapter of Economic Development, which was substantially rewritten for the second edition. Although this basic model abstracts from many particular features of cyclical change, Schumpeter considered it useful because, as he put it in 1939, it isolates the most essential cyclical elements in the absence of the “innumerable layers of secondary, incidental, accidental and ‘external’ facts and reactions” that “cover the skeleton of economic life, sometimes so as to hide it entirely.”43 The second approximation, described very briefly in Economic Development, and presented more fully in his later writings, incorporated supplementary, complicating features of business cycles, causing “secondary waves” on top of the underlying “primary wave.” The third approximation, alluded to in the preface to the English translation of Economic Development, in 1934, and developed in his 1939 study, distinguishes cycles of different lengths and amplitudes.

经济学思想史的讽刺之处在于……在二十世纪，熊彼特最令人印象深刻的成就之一，是他对商业周期的分析，而非他的经济发展理论。这在一定程度上证明了他周期分析的高超水平和创造性。正如阿尔文·H·汉森所精辟指出的，“在二十世纪初，现代商业周期理论几乎所有基本思想的起源，都出自五位欧洲大陆经济学家之手，熊彼特是其中最杰出、最具原创性的一位。” 44事实上，汉森指出，正是英语经济学家迟迟未能跟上欧洲大陆关于货币、商业周期及相关领域的文献步伐，才促成了《经济发展》一书于1934年被翻译成英文。 45 1939年，熊彼特关于周期的鸿篇巨著——两卷本著作的出版​​，进一步巩固了他作为一位周期理论家的形象，尽管他是一位才华横溢的理论家。毫无疑问，20世纪30年代的大萧条以及凯恩斯《就业、利息和货币通论》的出版和传播，进一步强化了经济学界对短期经济萧条和失业问题的关注，46而熊彼特周期理论在其哈佛大学同事阿尔文·汉森47和戈特弗里德·哈伯勒48的著作中的阐述也起到了同样的作用。

One of the ironies of the intellectual history of economics in the twentieth century is that Schumpeter is often remembered more for his analysis of business cycles than for his theory of economic development. In part, this is a testimony to the high quality and creativity of his cycle analysis. As Alvin H. Hansen aptly put it, “Schumpeter was one of the most brilliant and original of the five Continental writers who originated nearly all of the really basic ideas in modern business-cycle theory” in the early twentieth century.44 Indeed, Hansen observes that it was the belated effort of English-speaking economists to catch up with Continental literature on money, business cycles, and allied matters which led to the English translation of Economic Development in 1934.45 The publication, in 1939, of Schumpeter’s monumental two-volume study on cycles reinforced his image as essentially a cycle theorist, albeit a highly gifted one. No doubt, the emphasis of the economics profession upon short-run issues of depression and unemployment, stimulated by a combination of the Great Depression of the 1930s and the publication and dissemination of Keynes’s General Theory of Employment, Interest, and Money,46 further reinforced this process, as did the expositions of Schumpeter’s cycle theory in the prominent texts of his Harvard colleagues Alvin Hansen47 and Gottfried Haberler.48

然而，熊彼特的周期分析与他同时代的欧洲大陆经济学家——尤其是在经济发展领域——的区别恰恰在于，他明确而细致地将经济发展与周期性波动联系起来。在熊彼特看来，发展是通过一个周期性的过程实现的，而周期性波动也带来发展。因此，周期性波动并非经济增长的障碍，经济萧条也并非资本主义失败或崩溃的必然标志。事实上，周期性波动正是资本主义发展和增长的正常途径。

What differentiates Schumpeter’s cycle analysis, however, from that of his continental contemporaries—especially in Economic Development—is precisely his explicit and careful linkages between economic development and cyclical fluctuations. For Schumpeter, development occurs through a cyclical process, while cyclical disturbances bring development. Consequently, cyclical fluctuations are no barrier to economic growth, and depressions are not necessarily indicators of capitalist failure or breakdown. Indeed, cycles are the normal means by which capitalism develops and thereby grows.

这种观点体现在熊彼特的根本问题中：为什么经济发展呈周期性波动？创新并非均匀分布，而是“以群体或集群的形式不连续地出现”？熊彼特的答案是，创新并非“随时间均匀分布”，而是“即便出现，也只是以群体或集群的形式出现”。这句话概括了他关于发展和周期性波动的核心思想[223]。企业家在银行信贷的资助下，进行创新投资，这些投资涵盖新技术、资源发现等等。如果这些创新投资成功，模仿者就会在原有行业和其他行业效仿（例如，汽车行业的成功创新会刺激石油、橡胶轮胎、玻璃等领域的二次创新和投资），经济由此开启一段迅猛的上升期：繁荣。最终，创新完成，投资减少；大量消费品涌入市场，抑制了价格上涨；成本上升和利率上升挤压了利润空间：经济萎缩：衰退。

This perspective is reflected in Schumpeter’s fundamental question: why does economic development proceed cyclically rather than evenly? Schumpeter’s answer—that innovations are not “evenly distributed through time” but “appear, if at all, discontinuously in groups or swarms”—places his core interwoven ideas on both development and cyclical fluctuations in one sentence [223]. Entrepreneurs, financed by bank credit, make innovative investments embodying new technologies, resource discoveries, and so on. If these innovative investments are successful, imitators follow, in the original industry and elsewhere (for example, successful innovations in the automobile industry encourage secondary innovation and investment in petroleum, rubber tires, glass, and so on) and the economy embarks upon a dramatic upward surge: prosperity. Eventually, innovations are completed and investment subsides; an avalanche of consumer goods pours onto the market with dampening effects on prices; rising costs and interest rates squeeze profit margins: and the economy contracts: recession.

从这个角度来看，经济增长源于周期性发展，也是周期性发展的结果。创新投资的间歇性爆发是周期性波动的根本原因。系统内部发生的质变，即创新，与创新投资密切相关，是经济发展的根本动力。经济发展包含技术、组织和资源方面的变革，这些变革通过提高生产率和降低成本，为经济增长奠定了基础，即便面临商业周期的中断及其相关的经济衰退，经济增长依然能够持续，甚至正是由于这些中断和衰退，经济增长才得以实现。

In this perspective, economic growth emerges from and as a consequence of cyclical development. Discontinuous bursts of innovative investment are the basic, underlying cause of cyclical fluctuations. The qualitative changes arising from within the system which comprise innovations are associated with innovative investment and are the fundamental source of economic development. Economic development embodies technological, organizational, and resource changes which, by raising productivity and reducing costs, lays the foundations for economic growth despite, indeed because of, the interruptions of the business cycle and its associated economic contractions.

从这个角度来看，经济萧条（或者用现在的说法，温和衰退）在很大程度上是对先前繁荣时期创新集中爆发的一种正常且健康的适应过程。因此，萧条的根本原因恰恰是繁荣本身。如果我们想要繁荣，就必须接受随之而来的萧条。此外，经济萎缩反而会带来更高的实际收入。通过创新；迫使生产重组，提高效率，降低成本；并淘汰效率低下、缺乏创新的企业，因为新产品和新方法会取代旧产品和新方法，熊彼特后来称之为“永恒的创造性破坏之风”。 49

From this perspective, also, depressions (or, in current language, moderate recessions) are, largely, a normal and healthy process of adaptation to the bunching of innovations during the preceding prosperity. Thus, the fundamental cause of depression is prosperity itself. If we want prosperity, we must accept the depression which necessarily succeeds it. Moreover, economic contractions yield higher real incomes through innovation; force reorganizations of production, greater efficiency, and lower costs; and eliminate inefficient, non-innovating businesses, as new products and methods replace the old in what Schumpeter later called a “perennial gale of creative destruction.”49

当然，在实践中，经济周期和衰退的持续时间和幅度各不相同。首先，商业扩张虽然根植于创新，但可能会受到收入增长、投机性投资、过度乐观和信贷过度创造等因素的放大。在随后的衰退中，一旦第一波创新投资的动力耗尽，那些低效、无利可图且过度扩张的企业就会崩溃。此时的衰退将不仅仅是对繁荣时期创新成果的正常衰退调整和吸收，而是会演变成一场严重的经济萧条。对超级繁荣的清算和调整可能会陷入信贷减少、价格下跌和清算加剧的“恶性循环”，而投机性支出收缩和悲观主义的错误观念，甚至金融“恐慌”或“危机”，都会加剧这种循环。这些深度且持续时间长的衰退“从某种意义上说是病态的，因为它们在资本主义进程中并非不可或缺，没有它们，资本主义进程在逻辑上也是完整的。” 50

In practice, of course, cycles and economic contractions come in different lengths and amplitudes. First, business expansion, though rooted in innovation, may be amplified by such factors as rising incomes, speculative ventures, excess optimism, and excess credit creation. In the succeeding contraction, which occurs once the force of the primary wave of innovational investment has been spent, the unproductive, unprofitable, and overextended ventures crumble. Contraction will then involve more than a normal recessionary adjustment to and absorption of the innovations of the prosperity and will drop into a major, severe depression. Liquidation and adjustment to a super boom may descend into a “vicious spiral” of decreased credit, decreased prices, and increased liquidation, heightened by speculative contractions in spending and errors of pessimism, perhaps even financial “panic” or “crisis.” These deep, protracted depressions “are pathological in the sense that they play no indispensable role in the capitalist process, which would be logically complete without them.”50

由于经济萧条是对资本主义进程逻辑的异常偏离，并且取决于对特定失调的反应，因此“无法对经济萧条的发生和严重程度形成任何理论预期” 。51

Because they are abnormal deviations from the logic of the capitalist process and depend on reactions to specific malad-justments, “no theoretical expectation can be formed about the occurrence and severity of depressions.”51

事实上，经济大萧条中的恶性循环可能非常强大，以至于经济系统可能无法自行恢复，需要一些外部因素的帮助，例如政府行动或随机的有利事件。

Indeed, the vicious spiral in deep depressions conceivably may be so powerful that the system may not recover by itself and may require assistance from some external agent, like government action or a random favorable event.

其次，熊彼特在1939年的分析中区分了短周期、中周期和长周期，或者为了纪念它们的“发现者”，分别称之为3-4年的“基钦周期”、9-10年的“尤格拉周期”和54-60年的“康德拉季耶夫周期”。熊彼特将日期定为……康德拉季耶夫周期分为三个阶段：第一阶段从18世纪80年代到1842年，第二阶段从1842年到1897年，第三阶段从1898年到20世纪30年代末。他将第一阶段与“工业革命”联系起来，第二阶段与铁路建设联系起来，第三阶段则与化工、电力和汽车等行业的一系列更广泛的创新联系起来。康德拉季耶夫周期的关键不在于实际总产出绝对水平的周期性波动，而在于大规模的创新集群或序列，这些创新的出现和吸收需要半个世纪甚至更长时间。

Second, in his 1939 analysis, Schumpeter distinguished among short, medium, and long cycles, or, in honor of their “discoverers,” the 3-4-year “Kitchen,” the 9-10-year “Juglar,” and the 54-60-year “Kondratieff.” Schumpeter dated the first long-wave Kondratieff from the 1780s to 1842, the second from 1842 to 1897, and the third from 1898 to the end of the 1930s. The first of these long waves he associated with the “industrial revolution,” the second, with railroadization, the third, with a broader set of innovations in the chemical, electric power, and automobile industries. The key to the Kondratieff is not a cyclical movement in the absolute level of aggregate real output, but instead a large-scale clustering or sequence of innovations, the appearance and absorption of which require a half-century or more.

长波康德拉季耶夫周期与较短的周期，特别是主要的尤格拉周期，相互关联。显然，“这三个周期的对应阶段在任何时刻的重合，总是会产生异常强烈的现象，尤其当重合的阶段是繁荣期或萧条期时。” 52例如，康德拉季耶夫周期和尤格拉周期萧条阶段的重合，如19世纪70年代和20世纪30年代，可能导致持续时间异常长且程度严重的萧条；而尤格拉周期萧条发生在长波康德拉季耶夫周期上升期期间，例如1898年至20世纪20年代，则往往持续时间相对较短且程度较轻。

Long-wave Kondratieffs are interconnected with the shorter cycles, notably the major Juglars. It is “clear that the coincidence at any time of corresponding phases of all three cycles will always produce phenomena of unusual intensity, especially if the phases that coincide are those of prosperity or depression.”52 The coincidence of the depressionary phases of a Kondratieff and a Juglar cycle as, for example, in the 1870s and the 1930s, can produce exceptionally long, severe depressions, whereas Juglar depressions during a long-wave Kondratieff upswing as, for example, between 1898 and the 1920s, are apt to be relatively short and mild.

4. 虽然《经济发展》第一版包含一个总结性的社会学章节，且所有版本都融入了富有洞见的社会学评述，但在某种狭义却重要的意义上，熊彼特的社会学思想是“附带的，并且从属于经济论证”。 53毕竟， 《经济发展》的重点在于经济发展这一内部过程的运作。然而，从更广义的角度来看，这种观点具有误导性。首先，无论是在熊彼特的时代还是在当今时代，主流经济学都侧重于从既定的技术、制度和动机假设中推导出定理。相比之下，熊彼特将阐明这类数据中变革的机制作为其分析的核心。其次，熊彼特在阐明制度方面比同时代的人要明确得多。他的论证中存在一些问题。事实上，人们不禁会说，熊彼特在将制度变迁分析与经济理论相结合方面，在某种程度上比20世纪初主流经济学的“制度主义”批评者更为成功。至少，熊彼特的分析为索尔斯坦·凡勃伦和约翰·R·康芒斯等美国制度主义者的著作提供了一个有趣的欧陆式近似对应物。54

4. Although Economic Development in its first edition contained a concluding sociological chapter, and in all editions incorporated insightful sociological commentary, there is a narrow though important sense in which Schumpeter’s sociological thought is “incidental and subordinate to the economic argument.”53 After all, the focus of Economic Development is on the functioning of an internally-generated process of economic development. In a broader sense, however, this view is misleading. First, mainstream economics, in Schumpeter’s time as in our own, focused upon the derivation of theorems from given technological, institutional, and motivational assumptions. By contrast, Schumpeter made the specification of a mechanism of change in these kinds of data the core of his analysis. Second, Schumpeter was much more explicit than his contemporaries in specifying institutional aspects of his argument. Indeed, one is tempted to say that Schumpeter was more successful, in a limited way, in synthesizing an analysis of institutional change with economic theory than “institutionalist” critics of mainstream economics in the early twentieth century. At the very least, Schumpeter’s analysis provides an interesting Continental quasi analogue to the writings of such American institutionalists as Thorstein Veblen and John R. Commons.54

无论如何，熊彼特在其后来的著作中提供了大量的社会学和政治评论，尤其是在他的论文《帝国主义社会学》和《族群同质环境下的社会阶级》 55以及广为流传的著作《资本主义、社会主义与民主》中。此外，熊彼特身后出版的杰作《经济分析史》 （尽管风格略显古怪） 56也对经济理论在其历史发展中的社会文化背景和时代精神进行了详尽而深入的探讨。

In any event, Schumpeter provided considerable sociological and political commentary in his subsequent writings, notably in his papers on “The Sociology of Imperialisms” and “Social Classes in an Ethnically Homogeneous Environment,”55 and in his widely read work Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy. In addition, Schumpeter’s posthumously published, though somewhat eccentric, masterpiece History of Economic Analysis contains lengthy and learned discussion of the sociocultural setting and Zeitgeist of economic theories in their historical development.56

为了保持篇幅适中，我们不对这些著作的内容进行系统性的评述，读者可自行查阅其他资料了解详情。57然而，这里有两点值得一提，一点是方法论上的，另一点是实质性的，其中第二点需要更深入地探讨。首先，这些著作并非仅仅是对相邻但又有所区别的领域的浅尝辄止。相反，它们在战略上与《经济发展》一书中的分析相辅相成。如果说熊彼特1911年的早期著作侧重于资本主义的运作和发展，那么他后来的“社会学”研究则可以被描述为既是对这些早期思想的阐述和阐释，又通过考察资本主义的起源和转型、未来前景以及可能的继承者来对其进行补充。总而言之，熊彼特的毕生著作构成了一部或多或少完整的关于西方社会工业化资本主义的诞生、发展及其历史变迁的研究。

In the interest of reasonable brevity, we shall not review systematically the content of these works, and the reader is referred elsewhere for details.57 Two broad points, however, one methodological and the other substantive, should be mentioned here, the second in some depth. First, these writings are not mere forays into adjacent, but distinguishable, fields. Instead, they are strategically complementary to the analysis in Economic Development. If Schumpeter’s early work of 1911 may be said to focus on the functioning and development of capitalism, his subsequent “sociological” studies may be described as both elaborating and illustrating these early ideas and supplementing them by considering the origins and transformation of, the future prospects for, and the prospective successor(s) to capitalism. Together, Schumpeter’s lifeworks constitute a more or less integrated study of the birth, development, and historical transience of industrializing capitalism in Western societies.

此外，在熊彼特为纪念《共产党宣言》发表一百周年而作的文章中，他区分了“经济学”和“哲学”。“经济社会学”（源自德语Wirtschaftssoziologie）。熊彼特所说的经济学是指“对任何特定国家内部的经济机制，例如市场机制等制度的解释性描述”。而经济社会学则指对“与经济相关的制度，包括习惯和所有行为形式，例如政府、财产、私营企业、习俗或‘理性’行为”的解释性描述。 58在其著作《经济分析史》中，熊彼特指出，任何超越“狭义技术”的经济研究都具有一种制度性的引证，这种引证属于社会学而非经济史本身。因此，经济社会学必须作为“第四个基本领域”引入，以补充经济史、统计学和经济理论，即便这意味着要超越这三个领域所体现的“纯粹的经济分析”。59熊彼特非常钦佩马克思将经济分析和经济社会学（此处指经济分析和经济社会学）融合起来的能力。他认为，马克思的经济理论试图揭示社会阶级关系如何“通过经济价值、利润、工资、投资……等媒介发挥作用，以及它们最终如何打破自身的制度框架，同时为另一个社会世界的出现创造条件”。另一方面，马克思的经济社会学，特别是他的社会阶级理论，提供了一种“分析工具，它将历史的经济解释与利润经济的概念联系起来，从而梳理所有社会事实，使所有现象都聚焦于一点”。它具有“有机功能”，即综合马克思的资本主义发展理论，并将其转化为一个统一的整体。60熊彼特富有想象力地尝试用更广泛的社会学和历史视角来补充他对资本主义发展的更为严格的经济分析，探讨资本主义文明的起源、转型和未来，这同样值得称道。转而讨论第二个实质性问题，熊彼特的“社会学”著作，特别是《资本主义、社会主义和民主》，通过提供保守的、反社会主义的替代方案，对《经济发展》进行了阐述和补充，而这种替代方案既不同于马克思，也不同于凯恩斯。

Moreover, in his centennial essay on the Communist Manifesto, Schumpeter distinguishes between “economics” and “economic sociology” (from the German Wirtschaftssoziologie). By economics, Schumpeter means “the interpretive description of the economic mechanisms that play within any given state of … institutions, such as market mechanisms.” By economic sociology, Schumpeter denotes the interpretive description of “economically relevant institutions, including habits and all forms of behavior in general, such as government, property, private enterprise, customary or ‘rational’ behavior.”58 In his History of Economic Analysis, Schumpeter observes that any economic inquiry which goes beyond mere “technique in the most restricted sense of the word has such an institutional introduction that belongs to sociology rather than to economic history as such” and that, consequently, economic sociology must be introduced as a “fourth fundamental field to complement” economic history, statistics, and theory, even though this necessitates going beyond the “mere economic analysis” embodied in these three.59 Schumpeter greatly admired Marx’s ability to blend economic analysis and economic sociology, defined in these two senses. Marx’s economic theory, he suggests, attempted to show how social class relations “work out through the medium of economic values, profits, wages, investment … and how they will eventually break its own institutional framework and at the same time create the conditions for the emergence of another social world.” Marx’s economic sociology, on the other hand, especially his theory of social classes, provided “the analytic tool which, by linking the economic interpretation of history with the concepts of the profit economy, marshals all social facts, makes all phenomena confocal.” It had the “organic function” of synthesizing the Marxian theory of capitalist development and transforming it into a unified whole.60 Much the same sort of thing might be said about Schumpeter’s imaginative attempt to complement his more strictly economic analysis of capitalist development with a broader sociological and historical perspective on the origins, transformation, and future of capitalist civilization. Turning to the second, substantive point, Schumpeter’s “sociological” writings, notably Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy, elaborate and complement Economic Development by providing a conservative, antisocialist alternative to both Marx and Keynes.

简而言之，我们可以将马克思、凯恩斯和熊彼特之间的关系概括如下：马克思（1）指出了资本主义行为的一些主要特征（例如，经济萧条、收入分配不均），（2）将这些特征视为该体系的缺陷或矛盾，（3）并预言资本主义的消亡很大程度上是由于其经济矛盾。凯恩斯也（1）指出了资本主义的主要特征（特别是由于缺乏有效的自我调节机制而导致的失业倾向），（2）并将它们视为该体系的失败之处，但（3）提出了（有限的）改革方案来消除或控制这些失败之处。熊彼特在（1）上同意马克思和凯恩斯的观点，在（2）上不同意他们的观点，在（3）上同意马克思的观点，部分原因是凯恩斯式的自由主义劳工改革会产生一些不良的副作用。

In simplified terms, we may characterize the relations among Marx, Keynes, and Schumpeter as follows: Marx (1) identified some major properties of capitalist behavior (for example, depressions, inequality in income distribution), (2) designated these properties as flaws or contradictions of the system, and (3) predicted the death of capitalism significantly because of its economic contradictions. Keynes also (1) identified leading properties of capitalism (notably its proclivity toward unemployment because of the absence of a viable self-regulatory mechanism), and (2) designated them as failures of the system, but (3) proposed (limited) reforms of the system to eradicate or control them. Schumpeter agreed with both Marx and Keynes on (1), disagreed with both on (2), and agreed with Marx on (3), partly because of undesirable side effects of liberal-labor reforms of the Keynesian variety.

首先，我们来考察熊彼特对马克思的反应。尽管他在一些细节上与马克思有所分歧（例如，关于周期性强度增加和劳动“贫困化”加剧等长期趋势），但熊彼特从未否认马克思提出的资本主义主要矛盾特征的存在。阶级斗争、剩余价值、周期性危机、萧条、失业、财富、权力和收入的不平等，以及资本的垄断和集中，这些都被熊彼特的分析所涵盖。熊彼特对马克思的批判性评价与庞巴维克以及其他认真研究过马克思思想的熊彼特同时代人截然不同。61传统观点从静态均衡的角度否定了马克思的理论，尽管通常没有明确认识到这种批判的局限性。相比之下，熊彼特认为，稳态均衡是在如此严格的条件下定义的。这种过于简化的论述方式，使得排除资本与劳动关系、以利息和纯粹经济利润形式存在的剩余价值、经济萧条和失业等现象，几乎等同于同义反复。另一方面，从资本主义工业化和发展的动态视角来看，熊彼特完全能够认识到资本主义行为的这些方面。

Focusing first on Schumpeter’s reaction to Marx, it may be observed that, although he differed from Marx on details (for example, concerning such long-run tendencies as increasing cyclical intensity and increasing “immiserization” of labor), Schumpeter never denied the existence of any of Marx’s major contradictory features of capitalism. Class struggles, surplus values, cyclical crises, depressions, unemployment, inequality in wealth, power, and income, and monopoly and centralization of capital are all woven into Schumpeter’s analysis. The character of Schumpeter’s critical assessment of Marx is radically different from that of Böhm-Bawerk’s and other contemporaries of Schumpeter who bothered to consider Marx’s ideas.61 The conventional view rejected Marx’s theories from the perspective of stationary equilibrium, albeit typically without express recognition of the confining nature of the critique. For Schumpeter, by contrast, stationary equilibrium is defined in such an exacting and rarefied manner that the exclusion of such phenomena as capital-labor relations, surplus values in the form of interest and pure economic profits, depressions, and unemployment follow as a virtual tautology. On the other hand, Schumpeter is perfectly prepared to recognize the existence of these aspects of capitalist behavior, from the dynamic perspective of capitalist industrialization and development.

熊彼特对凯恩斯的回应与他对马克思的回应既有相似之处，也有不同之处。相似之处在于，熊彼特明确地认可并提供了一个理论框架来分析凯恩斯关于萧条和失业（以及财富和收入不平等）的主要论点。正如前文所述，熊彼特也认为凯恩斯和马克思的创作历程与他自身经历有相似之处，即他们都提出了早期的“愿景”，随后在更深入的理论层面加以完善。对马克思而言，这体现在从《共产党宣言》到《资本论》的转变过程中。熊彼特则认为，他自身从《经济发展》到《商业周期》的著作也存在类似的转变过程。对于凯恩斯而言，“在《和平的经济后果》（凯恩斯1917年的杰出早期研究）中首次揭示的社会愿景，即投资机会减少但储蓄习惯仍然存在的经济过程愿景，在1936年的《就业、利息和货币通论》中得到了理论上的实现。” 62最后，熊彼特对凯恩斯关于资本主义弊病的解释的异议，就像他对马克思分析的批判一样，以及他由此提出的对资本主义的替代性解释辩护，都是基于一个明确的动态理论框架。

Schumpeter’s response to Keynes was both similar to and different from that of his reaction to Marx. It was similar in that Schumpeter expressly recognized and provided a theoretical framework for analyzing Keynes’s major themes of depression and unemployment (as well as his minor theme of inequality in wealth and income). As already observed, Schumpeter also perceived a quality in the creative life-process of both Keynes and Marx similar to that of his own, that is, each presented an early “vision” subsequently worked out in greater theoretical depth. For Marx, this was represented by the movement from the Communist Manifesto to Capital. Schumpeter perceived a somewhat similar process in his own work from Economic Development to Business Cycles. For Keynes, the “social vision first revealed in the Economic Consequences of the Peace [Keynes’s brilliant early study of 1917], the vision of an economic process in which investment opportunity flags and saving habits nevertheless persist, is theoretically implemented in The General Theory of Employment, Interest and Money” of 1936.62 Lastly, Schumpeter’s dissent from Keynes’s interpretation of capitalism’s malaise, like his critique of Marx’s analysis, and his corollary alternative interpretative defense of capitalism is based on an explicitly dynamic theoretical framework.

尽管凯恩斯的分析包含“若干动态要素，尤其是预期”，但熊彼特认为，其分析体系的“确切框架”在于短期静态均衡领域。熊彼特指出，缺乏一个以动态为基础的理论框架正是凯恩斯分析的主要缺陷。63 “所有现象与……创造和变化……相关的现象，也就是说，主导资本主义进程的现象，因此被排除在考虑范围之外。” 64与之相反，熊彼特的替代方案既不同于凯恩斯，也不同于马克思，它明确地是动态的、演进的。

Although Keynes’s analysis contained “several dynamic elements, expectations in particular,” the “exact skeleton” of his analytical system, Schumpeter held, lay in the realm of short-run, static equilibrium. According to Schumpeter, the lack of a primarily dynamic theoretical framework is precisely the leading defect of Keynes’s analysis.63 “All the phenomena incident to … creation and change … that is to say, the phenomena that dominate the capitalist processes, are thus excluded from consideration.”64 By contrast, Schumpeter’s alternative to both Keynes and Marx is explicitly dynamic and evolutionary.

因此，熊彼特直接挑战了马克思和凯恩斯的观点。首先，无论资本主义存在何种矛盾倾向，它都取得了巨大的成功。其次，这些矛盾倾向实际上在工业化过程中发挥了创造性的作用。第三，资本主义没有可能在“经济失败”的重压下立即崩溃。例如，我们可以看看熊彼特对周期性萧条、不平等、剩余价值和垄断的动态解读。

Thus, Schumpeter confronts Marx and Keynes directly. First, whatever its contradictory proclivities, capitalism has been an immense success. Second, contradictory propensities actually perform a creative function in industrialization. Third, capitalism shows no likelihood of imminent breakdown under the weight of “economic failure.” To illustrate, consider Schumpeter’s dynamic interpretation of cyclical depressions, inequality and surplus values, and monopoly.

如前所述，在熊彼特的原始分析中，周期性波动并非经济增长的障碍，萧条也未必是资本主义失败或崩溃的标志。熊彼特1927年发表于《经济学》（Economica）杂志的文章，与《经济发展》（Economic Development）第二版同期出版，是对该书修订后最后一章的补充，应与该书一并阅读。在这篇文章中，熊彼特重述了他最喜欢的一个论断，该论断出自法国医生出身的经济学家克莱门特·朱格拉（Clement Juglar）之口，朱格拉于19世纪中期开创了商业周期研究的先河：“萧条的唯一原因是繁荣。”换句话说，“我们习惯称之为‘萧条’的现象并非一系列无序的波动，而是可以理解为商业活动对繁荣时期所创造的局面的一种反应……” 65随后，在《资本主义、社会主义与民主》一书中，熊彼特在其“第三近似”提出的三周期模型框架下，再次探讨了这一主题。熊彼特认为，1932年至1937年美国尤格拉周期的扩张阶段，展现出的创新和技术变革的种类和数量，大致相当于康德拉季耶夫周期衰退期间汽车、橡胶、钢铁和化工等行业所预期的水平。20世纪30年代的低迷表现也可以解释为……部分原因在于“适应新的财政政策、新的劳动立法以及政府对私营企业态度的总体转变所带来的困难……”。因此，即使是像20世纪30年代那样严重的经济萧条也“不能证明资本主义生产的驱动机制已经发生了长期断裂……”。 66此外，与马克思的预测相反，失业率占劳动力的百分比并没有呈现上升的长期趋势。如果资本主义基于其过去经验的未来经济前景能够实现，那么为失业者提供充足补偿的负担将会减轻，从而消除失业对“失业者私人生活”造成的重大“恐怖” 67。

In Schumpeter’s original analysis, as explained earlier, cyclical fluctuations are no barrier to economic growth, and depressions are not necessarily an indicator of capitalist failure or breakdown. Schumpeter’s “Economica” article of 1927, published about the time of the second edition of Economic Development, supplements the revised final chapter in that work and should be read in conjunction with it. In this article, Schumpeter reproduces one of his favorite propositions attributed to Clement Juglar, the French physician-turned-economist who initiated the study of business cycles in the mid-nineteenth century: “La cause unique de la depression c’est la prosperite.” Alternatively put, “the phenomena which we have got in the habit of calling ‘depression’ are no irregular heap of disturbances, but can be understood as the reaction of business life to the situation created by the boom….”65 Subsequently, in Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy, Schumpeter returns to this theme in the context of the three-cycle model presented in his “third approximation.” The expansionary phase of the Juglar cycle from 1932 to 1937 in the United States, Schumpeter argued, exhibited roughly the kind and amount of innovations and technological change to be expected in such industries as automobiles, rubber, steel, and chemicals during a Kondratieff down-swing. The subnormal performance of the 1930s also can be attributed in part “to the difficulties incident to the adaptation to a new fiscal policy, new labor legislation and a general change in the attitude of government to private enterprise.…” Thus, even severe depressions like those of the thirties do “not prove that a secular break has occurred in the propelling mechanism of capitalist production.…”66 Further, in contrast to Marx’s prognosis, unemployment as a percent of the labor force has shown no upward secular trend. If capitalism’s future economic promise, based on its past experience, were to be fulfilled, the burden of providing ample compensation for the unemployed would decrease, thereby eliminating the major “terror” of unemployment in terms of “the private life of the unemployed…”67

同样，经济不平等并非资本主义的缺陷或失败。在一个停滞不前的世界里，如果没有创新和经济发展，竞争最终会将利润降低到“正常”水平。但在一个充满活力、不断发展的经济体中，超额利润往往是创新的回报。由于创新存在巨大的不确定性——即失败的可能性以及成功后可能面临的竞争侵蚀——因此，巨额利润的诱惑和偶尔的实现，很可能正是社会为企业领袖的革命性贡献所付出的代价（第四章）。熊彼特也指出，马克思的剩余价值概念必须在动态的背景下理解。通过整合新技术和其他质的改变来源，企业家的创新创造了超过成本的收益盈余（从而也创造了支付利息的能力）。竞争往往会消除这些剩余价值，但创新却能重新创造它们。因此，熊彼特在动态条件下捍卫了马克思的结论（以及他自己的结论）：“剩余价值在完全均衡状态下或许不可能存在，但它却始终存在，因为这种均衡状态永远不会建立起来。它们可能总是趋向于消失，却又总是存在，因为它们不断地被重新创造。” 68

Similarly, economic inequality is not a flaw or failure of capitalism. In a stationary world, without innovation and economic development, competition eventually would reduce profits to “normal” levels. But in a dynamic, developing economy, above-normal profits are often the reward for innovation. Because of the tremendous uncertainties surrounding innovations—that is, the possibility of failure and the likelihood of competitive encroachment in the event of success—the lure and occasional realization of extraordinary profits may well be the price society pays for the revolutionary contributions of its business leaders (chapter 4). Marx’s concept of surplus values, Schumpeter also observes, must be understood in a dynamic context. By incorporating new technologies and other sources of qualitative change, entrepreneurial innovations create surpluses of revenues above costs (and thereby also the capacity to pay interest). Competition tends to eliminate these surplus values, but innovation recreates them. Thus, Schumpeter defends Marx’s conclusion (and his own) under dynamic conditions: “Surplus values may be impossible in perfect equilibrium but can be ever present because that equilibrium is never allowed to establish itself. They may always tend to vanish and yet be always there because they are constantly recreated.”68

此外，熊彼特在其后期的著作中还提出：资本主义在实践中通过多种方式减少不平等：首先，相对于早期阶级分明的社会，它增加了机会平等；其次，它创造了大规模生产的产品，这些产品比其他任何经济部门都更有利于劳动群众；第三，它通过资本主义经济增长过程所支持的慈善事业和社会立法；第四，虽然“相对贫困”或不平等对于维持资本主义是必要的，但随着资本主义的发展，“绝对贫困”会减少。

Furthermore, Schumpeter contended in his later writings, capitalism in practice reduces inequality in several ways: first, by increasing equality of opportunity relative to earlier, more class-bound societies; second, by the creation of mass-produced products that benefit working masses more than they do any other sector of the economy; third, by philanthropy and social legislation underwritten by the process of capitalist economic growth; and fourth, because although “relative poverty” or inequality is necessary for the sustenance of capitalism, “absolute poverty” falls as capitalist development proceeds.

熊彼特对垄断的评价与他对周期性萧条和不平等的论述相呼应。他清楚地认识到19世纪末20世纪初大企业的出现以及与之相关的寡头垄断和垄断企业的市场力量。他也认同马克思主义和非马克思主义的垄断批评者的观点，即静态均衡状态的比较表明，垄断-买方垄断企业的产出和投入低于竞争性企业，价格高于竞争性企业，工资也低于竞争性企业。然而，他否认垄断是资本主义“经济引擎”的缺陷、矛盾或失败。

Schumpeter’s assessment of monopoly parallels his commentary on cyclical depressions and inequality.
