He clearly recognizes the emergence of big business and the associated market power of oligopoly and monopoly enterprise in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries. He also agrees with both Marxian and non-Marxian critics of monopoly that comparisons of static equilibrium positions reveal lower outputs and inputs, higher prices, and lower wages for monopoly-monopsony enterprises than for competitive ones. Still, he denies that monopoly is a flaw, contradiction, or failure in capitalism’s “economic engine.”

熊彼特对垄断的评价在某种程度上反映了他将竞争视为一个动态过程而非一系列结构性条件或静态均衡的最终状态的观点。在这一点上，他更接近马克思，而非弗里德里希·哈耶克和米尔顿·弗里德曼等当代个人主义保守派经济学家。当代个人主义保守派的新自由主义，如同亚当·斯密和约翰·斯图亚特·密尔的古典自由主义一样，都建立在原子式竞争市场作为经济协调和企业控制的社会过程这一原则之上。相比之下，熊彼特对“大企业”作用的分析与19世纪末的自由放任保守主义和“社会达尔文主义”的某些特征有着惊人的相似之处。熊彼特的英雄不是竞争市场，而是富有创造力、敢于冒险的企业家，是“船长”。“工业巨头”是指那些进行创新、推出新产品、体现资源发现和技术改进、开拓新市场，并在这一过程中建立新的工业帝国的人。

In part, Schumpeter’s evaluation of monopoly reflects his conception of competition as a dynamic process rather than as a set of structural conditions or a static, equilibrium endstate. In this, he is closer to Marx than to such contemporary individualist-conservative economists as Friedrich Hayek and Milton Friedman. The neoliberalism of the contemporary individualist-conservatives, like the classical liberalism of Adam Smith and John Stuart Mill, rests on the principle of atomistically competitive markets as social processes for economic coordination and control of business enterprise. By contrast, Schumpeter’s analysis of the role of “big business” bears a striking resemblance to certain features of the laissez-faire conservatism and “Social Darwinism” of the late nineteenth century. Schumpeter’s hero is not the competitive market, but the creative, daring entrepreneur, the “captain of industry,” who makes the innovations that introduce new products, embodies resource discoveries and technological improvements, opens new markets, and, in the process, builds new industrial empires.

在熊彼特看来，企业家阶层的动态创新构成了经济发展中一股强大的竞争力量。“创造性破坏的永恒风暴”，即新产品和新工艺取代旧产品和新工艺，远比现有企业和产品之间的价格竞争重要得多。由于资本主义是一个动态的、演化的经济体系，因此，它以及企业的短期市场策略都必须从“创造性破坏的永恒风暴”的角度来评估，也就是从长期发展动力的角度来评估。真正“相关的问题”不是“资本主义如何管理现有结构”，而是“它如何创造和摧毁这些结构”。 69

To Schumpeter, the dynamic innovations of the entrepreneurial class constitute a powerful competitive force in economic development. The “perennial gale of creative destruction,” whereby new products and processes displace old ones, is vastly more important than price competition among existing firms and products. Because capitalism is a dynamic, evolutionary economic system, it, and short-run market strategies of business firms, must be appraised in terms of “the perennial gale of creative destruction,” that is, in terms of long-run developmental dynamism. The really “relevant problem” is not “how capitalism administers existing structures,” but “how it creates and destroys them.”69

换言之，短期内半垄断地位、协议和策略，以及随之而来的资源配置短期低效和收入分配不平等，很可能是为创新投资提供基础的必要条件，而创新投资能够带来更佳的长期绩效和更激烈的长期竞争。企业家精神在很大程度上可能取决于一种制度性的社会政治结构，这种结构允许创新者获得保护（例如通过专利和秘密工艺），并通过操纵价格、数量和质量变量来创造纯粹的经济利润，而这些操纵手段在短期内看似具有限制性和垄断性。因此，至少在短期内保留创新带来的超额利润的可能性，很可能刺激更高的创新率和技术进步。因此，保护​​创新者垄断地位的短期策略和实践，可能是社会为技术进步以及由此带来的长期更高增长率所付出的代价。此外，由于创新具有扩散的趋势，模仿和扩展到相关领域，工业先驱的垄断地位——以及相关的垄断利润——只是暂时的[152]。

Stated differently, it is quite possible that short-run semi-monopolistic positions, agreements, and strategies, with accompanying short-run inefficiencies in resource allocation and inequalities in income distribution, are necessary to provide a basis for the innovational investment that brings greater long-run performance and more vigorous long-run competition. Entrepreneurship may be, in large measure, a function of an institutional sociopolitical structure which permits protection (through, for example, patents and secret processes) to the innovator and the generation of pure economic profits through the manipulation of price, quantity, and quality variables via techniques which in the short run appear restrictive and monopolistic. Thus, the possibility of retention, at least temporarily, of above-normal profits from innovations may well stimulate a higher rate of innovation and technological improvement. Short-run strategies and practices that protect the monopoly position of the innovator thus may be the price society pays for technological progress and thereby a higher growth rate over the long run. Moreover, because of the tendency for innovations to spread, by imitation and extension to allied fields, the monopoly position—and associated monopoly profits—of the industrial pioneer is only temporary [152].

第四

IV

《经济发展》一书的接受度和影响经历了三个主要阶段，大致与该书的三个版本相对应。第三阶段与人们对其在《商业周期》一书中成熟分析的反响交织在一起。第一版的反响普遍积极。事实上，正如熊彼特在20世纪20年代末于波恩大学的杰出学生埃里希·施耐德所言，熊彼特的著作“在国际专业界引起了轰动”。 70例如，一位热情洋溢的早期评论家在评论《经济理论的本质和主要内容》和《经济发展》两部著作时宣称：“在经济学领域，很少有比熊彼特的这两卷著作更清晰连贯的论证……他展现了渊博的知识……敏锐的观察力……严密的推理……以及在筛选和融合新旧观念方面的无畏精神和敏锐的洞察力……毫无疑问，他开辟了道路，并取得了非凡的启发性和启示性成果。” 71另一位评论第一版的评论者写道：“这位评论者……认为没有哪本书比这本书更能激发经济理论课堂的学习兴趣，他认为本书的建设性理论包含许多注定会成为经济理论永久组成部分的内容。” 72即使是像RS Howey这样持批评态度的评论者，作为奥地利学派和边际效用经济学传统的坚定拥护者，也承认本书包含“非正统且大胆的观点……” Howey继续说道，熊彼特这部开创性著作的英文译本“无疑会增加他的批评者，也可能增加他的追随者……显然，该理论的基本原理是那些尚未达成一致，而且不太可能达成一致的观点。”他欣然接受了这一观点……”。但他总结道，这本书“对经济过程描绘了一幅精彩而又非传统的图景” 。73

The reception and impact of Economic Development proceeded through three main stages, roughly paralleling the work’s three editions, the third phase becoming mingled with reaction to his mature analysis in Business Cycles. Responses to the first edition were generally favorable. Indeed, in the words of Erich Schneider, Schumpeter’s prominent student at the University of Bonn in the late 1920s, Schumpeter’s work “created a sensation in international professional circles.”70 One enthusiastic early reviewer, for example, commenting on both The Essence and Principal Contents of Economic Theory and Economic Development, declared: “Seldom has clear and consecutive reasoning had more definite expression in economics than in Schumpeter’s two volumes … He shows rare knowledge … keenness of observation … coherence in reasoning, and … fearlessness and discrimination in sifting and combining old notions with new.… Beyond question he has blazed paths [and] yielded results unusually stimulating and suggestive.”71 Another reviewer of the first edition wrote: “The reviewer … knows no book that would be more stimulating to a class in economic theory, and he feels that the constructive doctrine of the book contains much that is destined to become a permanent part of economic theory.”72 Even critical reviewers, such as R.S. Howey, a strong advocate of the Austrian and marginal utility traditions in economics, acknowledged the “unorthodox and audacious ideas which the book contains.…” The English translation of Schumpeter’s seminal work, Howey continued, “certainly will add to the list of his critics and possibly to the list of his followers.… It is apparent that the fundamentals of the theory are those which have not met, and are not likely to meet, with ready acceptance.…” Still, he concludes, the book gives “a brilliant and unconventional picture of the economic process.”73

大多数评论者都认为熊彼特的动态方法论和发展框架是他原创贡献的核心。例如，RC McCrea指出：“熊彼特的思想超越了物理学家经济学家的机械论解释。他做出了重大贡献，引领我们走向更新的演化方法和演化视角。” 74 JB Clark在另一篇早期评论中宣称，《经济发展》将资本、利息和利润等现象与“经济演化”联系起来，“并研究它们在变化和进步的世界中的表现。因此，它对数量有限的、有意识地、系统地研究通常被称为‘经济动力学’的科学文献做出了重要补充。” 75英国评论家LB Namien在评论《经济发展》第一版时也同样指出， “自发的经济发展，由经济生活中的新组合带来的发展，以及建设性的经济领导力” 76是熊彼特的核心主题。奥斯卡·摩根斯坦在其对第二版的评论中指出，该书“首次以真正意义上的详尽动态经济学阐述了经济规律，因此具有革命性意义……”。77汉斯·奈瑟在其对英文译本的评论中称熊彼特的著作提供了“第一个现实的经济发展理论”。 78 汉森在其对英文译本的高度评价中指出，“在其他任何地方都找不到像本书这样对发展过程、经济动态的重要特征进行如此深刻的阐述，这与本质上静态的社会的‘循环流动’形成了鲜明对比。” 79西蒙·库兹涅茨在其对《商业周期》的详尽评论中强调了熊彼特的周期分析与他“关于资本主义演进总体进程的发人深省的判断”之间的密切联系。80三年后，保罗·M·斯威齐指出，尽管熊彼特经济发展理论中最重要的部分“属于英美经济学传统范畴，即关注商业周期的部分”，但他的基本目标“恰恰是揭示资本主义社会经济变革的本质”。斯威齐继续说道，这与传统的英美经济学形成鲜明对比，后者“历来满足于将注意力局限于所谓资本主义经济的正常运行”。 81

Most reviewers recognized Schumpeter’s dynamic methodology and developmental framework as the core of his original contribution. According to R.C. McCrea, for example, “Schumpeter’s thought has advanced beyond the mechanistic interpretation of the physicist-economist. He has made a significant contribution in carrying us over to the newer evolutionary method and evolutionary viewpoint.”74 J.B. Clark, in another early review, declared that Economic Development connects such phenomena as capital, interest, and profit with “economic evolution and it studies them as they appear in a world of change and progress. It thus makes an important addition to the limited amount of scientific literature which deals consciously and systematically with what is commonly termed ‘economic dynamics.’”75 L.B. Namien, an English reviewer of the first edition of Economic Development, similarly identifies “spontaneous, economic development, development due to new combinations in economic life, to constructive economic leadership,”76 as Schumpeter’s central theme. Oscar Morgenstern, in his review of the second edition, states that it is, “since it gives the first elaborate dynamic economics in the proper sense, very revolutionary….”77 Hans Neisser, in his review of the English translation, describes Schumpeter’s book as providing “the first realistic theory of economic development.”78 “Nowhere else,” Hansen observed in his highly favorable review of the English translation, “does one find so penetrating a treatment as here of the significant characteristics of the process of development, of economic dynamics, in contrast with the ‘circular flow’ of an essentially static society.”79 Simon Kuznets, in his extensive review of Business Cycles, emphasized the close connection between Schumpeter’s cycle analysis and his “thought-provoking judgments concerning the general course of capitalist evolution.”80 Three years later, Paul M. Sweezy observes that, although the most important part of Schumpeter’s theory of economic development “which falls within the traditional scope of Anglo-American economics is that which is concerned with business cycles,” his basic objective “is nothing less than to lay bare the anatomy of economic change in capitalist society.” This contrasts, Sweezy continues, with conventional English and American economics which “[have] traditionally been content to confine [their] attention to what may be called the normal functioning of the capitalist economy.”81

《经济发展》一书当之无愧地奠定了熊彼特的国际声誉。尽管他后期的著作扩展、阐释、补充并在一定程度上修正了他早期的思想，但他理论体系的核心内容却是在1911年以“直白的阐述和令人信服的论证”呈现的，而这种水平他此后再未达到。 82这本书无疑已成为一部“经典”。此外，熊彼特动态的方法论和对演化过程的洞见对后世学者产生了深远而有益的影响。例如，汉森关于商业周期的研究，其受熊彼特（以及其他20世纪早期欧洲大陆学者）的影响，或许与受凯恩斯（通常被认为是汉森的导师）的影响一样大。83约翰·莫里斯·克拉克（J·B·克拉克的儿子）关于“竞争的动态过程”以及爱德华·梅森关于新产品和产品设计形式的竞争的著作，都体现了熊彼特思想的深刻影响。84虽然斯威齐反对熊彼特关于企业家（而非资本积累）才是变革的首要推动力的观点，但他非常赞同熊彼特“将创新视为经济发展的核心特征”的观点，85并将创新纳入马克思主义分析的重要组成部分。事实上，斯威齐和保罗·巴兰对垄断资本主义的分析正是基于这样一种认知：在熊彼特式的“信托化资本主义”下，大型企业面临着巨大的创新压力，这种压力会降低生产成本。由此，他用“剩余价值上升规律”取代了马克思在竞争性资本主义下提出的“利润率下降规律”。86自熊彼特1950年去世以来，发展经济学领域蓬勃发展，其思想既有直接影响，也有间接影响。埃弗雷特·E·哈根等人借鉴熊彼特的基本观点，挑战了将技术仅仅视为作用于经济体系的外部力量的传统观念，并将研究范围扩大到涵盖从传统社会向发展中社会转型过程中技术变革的制度和社会文化基础。87理查德·纳尔逊等人则扩展了对创新扩散和跨国技术转移过程的分析。 88

Economic Development justly established Schumpeter’s international reputation. Although his later work amplified, illustrated, supplemented, and to some degree amended his early ideas, the central core of his theoretical system was presented in 1911 “with a directness of exposition and a cogency of argument that he was never again to attain.”82 The book has certainly become a “classic.” Moreover, Schumpeter’s dynamic methodology and vision of the evolutionary process have had significant and salutary effects on later writers. Hansen’s work on business cycles, for example, reflects the influence of Schumpeter (and other early twentieth century Continental scholars) perhaps as much as it does that of Keynes, normally perceived as Hansen’s mentor.83 Writings of John Maurice Clark (the son of J.B. Clark) on “competition as a dynamic process” and of Edward Mason on competition in the form of new products and product design display a strong Schumpeterian influence.84 Although Sweezy objects to Schumpeter’s notion of the entrepreneur (rather than capital accumulation) as the premium mobile of change, he strongly agrees with Schumpeter’s “conception of innovation as a central feature of economic development,”85 and incorporates innovation as an important component of a Marxian analysis. Indeed, the analysis of monopoly capitalism, by Sweezy and Paul Baran, rests upon the perceived innovational pressures of large firms under a kind of Schumpeterian “trustified capitalism,” pushing down production costs, thereby substituting a “law of rising surplus” for Marx’s original notion of a “law of the falling rate of profit” under competitive capitalism.86 The field of the economics of development, which has mushroomed since Schumpeter’s death in 1950, exhibits both direct and indirect influence of his ideas. Drawing upon Schumpeter’s basic perspective, Everett E. Hagen and others have challenged the traditional view of technology as simply an external force impinging on the economic system, and have broadened the scope of their inquiry to encompass institutional and sociocultural bases of technological change in the process of transition from traditional to developing societies.87 Richard Nelson and others have extended the analysis of the diffusion of innovations and the process of cross-country technological transfer.88

然而，尽管《经济发展》展现了卓越的才华和独创性，获得了评论界的一致好评，并产生了直接和间接的影响，但熊彼特征服经济学界、如同知识武士般重塑经济学并开辟全新道路的宏伟目标却始终未能实现。熊彼特的野心超越了他的能力；他所渴望的思想变革最终未能实现。毫无疑问，部分原因在于其出版的时机不佳。他的经典著作德文版首版于第一次世界大战前夕出版。以​​凯恩斯为代表的英语经济学家大多对此书置之不理，而战争的爆发又将经济学家的注意力转移到了更为紧迫和实际的问题上。等到英语世界的经济学界开始赶上欧洲大陆的学术步伐，并在1934年安排了《经济发展》的英文译本时，西方资本主义国家已深陷现代史上最严重的经济大萧条之中。经济学家和政治家一样，都无意对那些英雄般的工业领袖的活动及其创新成果进行热情洋溢的描述性分析。经济发展方面的探索。1936年凯恩斯《通论》的出版，极大地强化了这种情绪。到20世纪30年代末《商业周期》出版时，经济萧条已经开始缓解。但是，战争的紧迫性和对凯恩斯主义分析的深入理解，吸引了众多经济学家的注意力。

Yet, despite the brilliance and originality demonstrated in Economic Development, its critical acclaim, and its direct and indirect influence, Schumpeter’s bold objective of conquering the world of economics like an intellectual samurai, and reconstructing and redirecting the discipline along radically new paths, was never achieved. Schumpeter’s reach exceeded his grasp; the intellectual transformative effect for which he yearned eluded him. Part of the explanation for this, no doubt, lies in unfortunate circumstances of timing. The first edition of his classic work was published, in German, shortly before World War I. English-speaking economists, for example, Keynes, largely ignored the book, and the outbreak of war shifted economists’ attentions to more immediate, practical issues. By the time the English-speaking world of economics began to catch up with Continental literature and an English translation of Economic Development was arranged in 1934, the Western capitalist countries were in the depths of the greatest depression in modern history. Economists, no less than politicians, were in no mood for glowing descriptive analyses of the activities of heroic captains of industry and the effects of their innovative ventures on economic development. The publication, in 1936, of Keynes’s General Theory, profoundly reinforced this mood. By the time Business Cycles was published, in the very late 1930s, depression had begun to abate. But, the exigencies of war and the absorption of the Keynesian analysis demanded the attention of many members of the economics profession.

除了这些外部环境因素外，熊彼特自身的经历和性格也产生了影响。如前所述，第一次世界大战后，熊彼特在政府和商界工作了数年，基本上放弃了学术研究。20世纪20年代末，纳粹革命前夕，他在波恩大学的短暂任教经历虽然成果丰硕且影响深远，但并未让他有时间建立深厚的学术根基。而他在哈佛大学的求学生涯又受到经济萧条和战争的冲击。

In addition to these external circumstances were factors of Schumpeter’s own life and temperament. After World War I, as noted earlier, Schumpeter spent several years in government and business, largely withdrawn from academic pursuits. His brief period at the University of Bonn in the late 1920s, on the eve of the Nazi revolution, although highly productive and influential, did not give him time to establish deep intellectual roots, and his years at Harvard were disrupted by depression and war.

或许更重要的是，熊彼特的性格与他自身的抱负存在冲突。尽管他拥有“众多热情的仰慕者和无数忠诚的学生”，但他却积极阻止建立熊彼特式的“学派”。 89 例如，在波恩大学向学生们发表的告别演说中，他宣称：“我从未试图建立一个熊彼特学派。它并不存在，也不应该存在……经济学不是哲学，而是一门科学。因此，我们的领域不应该存在任何‘学派’。” 90在哈佛大学，他的教学项目——经济理论、经济思想史、商业周期和社会主义——与他的基本学术兴趣相符，并为他传播自己的观点提供了充足的机会和有效的平台。但是，正如他的许多学生和同事所抱怨的那样，“有一个不可饶恕的疏漏；他的学生从未听过一个字的熊彼特经济学。” 91即使在他的著作中，熊彼特也试图尽量减少争议，人们怀疑这是吸引追随者的一个重要因素。在《经济发展》英文译本的序言中，熊彼特指出，他并没有效仿……“我伟大的老师庞巴维克，他极其认真地听取了每一个反对意见或批评，并在后来的版本中加入了自己的评论”[x]。此外，与凯恩斯不同，熊彼特始终拒绝为了便于快速阐述和分析而将自己的论点简化（或允许他人简化）。而且，正如我们已经观察到的（同样与凯恩斯不同），他也没有为了便于得出短期问题的政策结论而构建或调整自己的分析。简而言之，熊彼特的性情使他不倾向于任何知识创新者通常用来聚集追随者和传播其观点的做法。

Perhaps even more important, Schumpeter was temperamentally at odds with his own ambitions. Despite his “many ardent admirers and scores of devoted students,” he actively discouraged establishment of a Schumpeterian “school” of thought.89 In a farewell address to his students at Bonn, for example, he declared: “I have never tried to bring about a Schumpeter school. There is none and it ought not to exist…. Economics is not a philosophy but a science. Hence there should be no ‘schools’ in our field.”90 At Harvard, his teaching program—economic theory, history of economic thought, business cycles, and socialism—paralleled his fundamental intellectual interests and provided ample opportunity and an effective platform for propagation of his views. But, as many of his students and colleagues complain, “there was an unforgivable omission; his students never heard one word of Schumpeterian economics.”91 Even in his written works, Schumpeter tried to minimize controversy, an important ingredient one suspects, in attracting epigones. In the preface to the English translation of Economic Development Schumpeter observes that he did not follow the example of “my great teacher Böhm-Bawerk who, with infinite care, took notice of every objection or critique and embodied his own comments in his later edition” [x]. Moreover, in contrast to Keynes, Schumpeter consistently refused to simplify his argument by stating it (or permitting others to state it) in skeletal form to facilitate quick exposition and analysis. Nor, as we have already observed (again, in contrast to Keynes) did he construct or adapt his analysis so as to facilitate drawing policy conclusions for short-run problems. In short, Schumpeter was temperamentally indisposed toward any of the kinds of things an intellectual innovator normally does to gather a following and propagate his views.

熊彼特对其他经济学家的论述中，可以明显看出他既有强烈的追求学术成就和影响力的动力，又有反对那些可能助长这些抱负的行为的原则性立场。例如，在谈到庞巴维克时，他指出庞巴维克的成功来得缓慢。庞巴维克“完全凭借其文字论证的力量而获得认可，他没有追求文学上的成功，没有诉诸公众舆论，没有进行新闻宣传，也没有参与学术政治——也就是说，他没有使用任何那些即便有时必要或合理，却有损学术事业最高理想的手段——也没有引起怨恨或卷入个人争吵。” 92熊彼特将帕累托描述为一个“独立且好斗的人……习惯于在辩论中毫不留情地反击那些可能对某些人有利的论点”，因此，他认为帕累托“几乎没有可能获得民众的欢迎”。93考虑到瓦尔拉斯的“远见卓识”与当时该行业的关注点“相去甚远”，而且他的创新之处主要在于“看待事物的方式，而非那些能吸引广大受众兴趣和理解的发现和发明……因此，不难理解，他不可能轻易或迅速获得外部成功。” 94门格尔，给出另一个例子是，他并不了解“科学广告”这种利用宣传手段来推广自己思想的策略，而且无论如何，“他缺乏开展宣传活动的手段。但他强大的力量穿透了重重阻碍，战胜了所有敌军。” 95熊彼特对他的思想英雄们的这些评价，同样也适用于他自己。相比之下，熊彼特对马歇尔和凯恩斯等经济学家更容易或更迅速地取得实际成功的评价，则既有钦佩，也有批评，有时甚至带有一丝居高临下的意味。马歇尔希望写出一本能被商人阅读和理解的书，被熊彼特描述为一种“奇怪的野心”。他的“分析框架”被描述为“嵌入在一个华丽的框架中，旨在安抚和安慰外行人”。与熊彼特截然相反，马歇尔“出于一颗热情的心，欣然同情社会主义的理想，却又冷静地、居高临下地对社会主义者进行说教”。马歇尔“宣扬维多利亚中期的道德观，并受到边沁主义的影响，这种道德观建立在缺乏魅力和激情的中产阶级价值观之上”，这令熊彼特个人感到“恼火”，而且在科学论著中出现这种观点也令人质疑其恰当性。96凯恩斯的成就更多地体现在他创建了“凯恩斯学派”和一套意识形态纲领，而非其分析能力。97

This combination of a powerful drive for intellectual achievement and influence and principled opposition against actions likely to promote these aspirations is discernible in Schumpeter’s writings on other economists. On Böhm-Bawerk, for example, he observes that success was slow in coming. Böhm achieved recognition “solely through the force of his written argument, without pursuing literary success, without appeal to public opinion, without a journalistic campaign, without academic politics—that is, without any of those means which, granting that they may occasionally be necessary or justifiable, fall short of the highest ideals of scholarly enterprise—and without causing bitterness or engaging in personal squabbles.”92 Schumpeter describes Pareto as a person of “independence and pugnacity … in the habit of dealing vigorous blows right in the midst of arguments that might in themselves be agreeable to some party or another” and thus as one who “has little chance of being popular.”93 Considering that Walras’s “vision” was “as far removed from the current interests of the profession as was the case” and that his novelty consisted essentially “in the manner of looking at things and not in discoveries and inventions which appeal to the interest and understanding of wide circles … it is readily understood that external success could come neither easily nor quickly.”94 Menger, to give another example, was innocent of the tactics of “scientific advertising” as means to gain acceptance of his ideas, and in any event “lacked the means of conducting his own campaigns. But his powerful strength penetrated through all the jungles and triumphed over all the hostile armies.”95 These commentaries by Schumpeter on his intellectual heroes might just as easily have been written about Schumpeter himself. By contrast, Schumpeter’s assessment of the easier or more rapid achievement of practical success by such economists as Marshall and Keynes combine admiration with reproof and, on occasion, a trace of condescension. Marshall’s desire to present a text which would be read and understood by businessmen is described as a “strange ambition.” His “analytic schema” is described as being “embedded in a luxuriant frame that conciliates and comforts the layman.” In exact opposition to Schumpeter, Marshall “cheerfully sympathized, from a warm heart, with the ideals of socialism and patronizingly talked down to socialists from a cool head.” Marshall’s “preaching of mid-Victorian morality, seasoned by Benthamism, the preaching from a schema of middle-class values that knows no glamour and no passion” was personally “irritating” to Schumpeter and of questionable propriety in a scientific treatise.96 Keynes’s achievements are described more in terms of the creation of a “Keynesian school” and an ideological program than analytical prowess.97

熊彼特对“学派”概念的摒弃，既体现了他严谨的学术态度，又带有一种天真的气质。事实上，社会科学领域内部确实存在着各种学派，而且这种现象并非毫无道理。当然，在某种程度上，不同的理论会在同一领域争夺影响力。例如，20世纪80年代初，货币主义经济学家、凯恩斯主义者和供给侧经济学家就里根政府经济政策的预期影响展开了辩论。然而，在大多数情况下，经济思想发展史中不同观点之间的区别，在于它们提出的问题或提出的见解各不相同。与其说是不同理论视角之间的差异，不如说是它们对同一问题的不同回答之间的差异。因为不同的理论视角往往是互补的而非竞争的，所以它们可以合理地共存，并丰富我们对社会现象的理解。此外，“检验”经济理论本身就充满诸多困难，其中最主要的一点是，诸如古典经济学、新古典经济学、马克思主义经济学、凯恩斯主义经济学和制度主义经济学等不同的理论结构，并非简单的单一假设，而是错综复杂的思想体系。

Schumpeter’s eschewal of “schools” of thought combines intellectual integrity with a basic naïveté. In fact, there are schools of thought within social scientific disciplines, and with good cause. To some extent, of course, rival theories contend for influence in the same domains. For example, monetarist, Keynesian, and supply-side economists in the early 1980s debated the prospective effects of the Reagan administration’s economic policies. In most instances, however, contending perspectives in the historical development of economic thought may be distinguished by the different questions they have asked or insights they have brought rather than primarily by the different answers they have given to the same questions. Because different theoretical perspectives are often complementary rather than competitive, they may validly coexist and enrich understanding of social phenomena. Moreover, “testing” economic theories is fraught with major difficulties, not the least of which is that such alternative theoretical structures as classical, neoclassical, Marxian, Keynesian, and institutionalist economic thought constitute intricate congeries of ideas rather than simple, single hypotheses.

由于社会理论中存在多种相互竞争的观点，构建“熊彼特学派”之外的一个主要策略是吸收其他学科的研究方法。在某种程度上，熊彼特确实做到了这一点。但这种方法也面临着诸多障碍。马克思主义者对熊彼特关于资本主义发展和转型的远见卓识和宏伟蓝图赞赏有加。然而，他对社会主义的保守意识形态上的反感，他只在动态条件下才考虑财产和权力关系，以及他（从马克思主义视角来看）过分强调企业家精神而非资本积累，使得即使是像熊彼特的学生保罗·斯威齐这样友好的马克思主义者，也对他保持着一定的学术距离。熊彼特在制度主义者那里也同样处境艰难。一些制度主义学者赞扬熊彼特将“资本主义演进及其可能衰落的整个历程”纳入其研究范畴，这与凡勃伦和康芒斯等经济学家形成鲜明对比，后者的分析“局限于有限的时间框架，并且主要以美国的情况为参照”。98不过总的来说，熊彼特对制度主义发展进程的影响并不显著。他实证主义的经济科学方法以及他对社会改革的漠不关心，甚至可以说是不信任，无疑有助于解释这一点。例如，在艾伦·G·格鲁奇关于该主题的全面著作中，他的名字只出现过一次，是在对米切尔著作的脚注中。“周期理论”。99熊彼特对凯恩斯的敌意（如前所述），加上他对将自己的分析与凯恩斯主义思想融合缺乏兴趣——即便两者之间存在互补关系，且某种形式的综合或许可行——这些都削弱了他影响后凯恩斯主义思想方向和发展的可能性。100

Because of the coexistence of contending perspectives in social theory, a major alternative strategy to building a “Schumpeterian school” would have been to infiltrate other approaches to the discipline. To some degree, Schumpeter did this. But there were important barriers to this approach. Marxists found much to admire in Schumpeter’s vision and grand design of capitalist development and transformation. But his conservative ideological antipathy toward socialism, his exclusion of consideration of property and power relations except under dynamic conditions, and his (from the Marxist perspective) overemphasis on entrepreneurship relative to capital accumulation kept even such friendly Marxists as Schumpeter’s student, Paul Sweezy, at an intellectual distance. Schumpeter typically fared no better at the hands of institutionalists. Some institutionalist writers have praised Schumpeter for taking “the entire story of capitalist evolution and possible decline” as his province, in contrast to economists such as Veblen and Commons, whose analyses have been framed “within a limited time perspective and with reference chiefly to American conditions.”98 Generally, though, Schumpeter’s influence on the course of institutionalism has been mild. His positivist approach to economic science and his disinterest in, indeed distrust of, social reform no doubt help explain this. His name appears only once, for example, in Allan G. Gruchy’s comprehensive volumes on the subject, in a footnote reference to Mitchell’s “cycle theory.”99 Schumpeter’s hostility toward Keynes, described earlier, combined with his lack of interest in blending his analysis with Keynesian ideas where the relationship between the two was complementary and where some sort of synthesis might have been feasible, diminished his chances for influencing the direction and development of post-Keynesian thought.100

熊彼特最大的失望或许在于，他的一些奥地利学派和新古典主义的著名同事对他的《经济发展》一书反应冷淡，尤其是在其利率理论方面。熊彼特认为，在循环流动的严格静态条件下，利率将为零，因为假定不存在对现在而非未来的系统性时间偏好（而这种偏好又基于生产和消费的同步性），并且当那些较为迂回的生产方式成为常规操作时，通过投资于这些方式来获取额外利润的机会就会耗尽。在一个以稳定经济增长（而非发展）为特征的经济体中，熊彼特论点的一个变体允许人们在储蓄增加的情况下，即使没有创新，也能采取一些能够带来正利润率（以及相应的低利率）的投资机会。因此，围绕熊彼特在静态经济中利率理论的批评所引发的“争议之网”通常被视为对其经济发展理论核心主题的一次不幸的偏离。 “任何人如果持有某种利率理论，认为循环流动中存在某种正利率，那么他完全可以自由地在熊彼特体系中任何他认为合适的地方插入这一修正。” 102

Schumpeter’s greatest disappointment must have been the cool reception Economic Development received from some of his prominent Austrian and neoclassicist colleagues, notably concerning his theory of interest. In the strictly stationary conditions of the circular flow, Schumpeter argued, interest rates would be zero, because of the assumed absence of systematic time preference for the present over the future (based, in turn, on synchronization of production and consumption) and because opportunities for additional profits through investment in more roundabout methods of production become exhausted when those methods are a matter of routine. In an economy characterized by stable economic growth (but not development), a variant of Schumpeter’s argument would permit some investment opportunities yielding a positive rate of profit (and an accompanying, though low, rate of interest) to be adopted as saving increased, even in the absence of innovations. Consequently, the “web of controversy”101 surrounding criticism of Schumpeter’s theory of interest in a stationary economy is often regarded as merely an unfortunate digression from the central themes of his theory of economic development. “Anyone who holds a theory of interest according to which some positive rate would exist in the circular flow is perfectly free to insert this correction into the Schumpeterian System at whatever point he feels it appropriate to do so.”102

当然，熊彼特格外用心，帮助他那些思想较为正统的同事们顺利过渡到一种新的经济生活视角。他在《经济学》早期就天真地提出了静止循环流的经济理论。在构建经济发展理论时，他认为发展“只需在其基础上加以改进，便能服务于其自身目的”[61]。此外，他继续说道，他的发展理论不会提出诸如“究竟是哪些（发展性的）变化造就了现代经济体系？”或“这些变化的条件是什么？”之类的宽泛的历史性问题。我们只问，而且实际上也像所有理论一样，问的是：这些变化是如何发生的，以及它们会产生哪些经济现象？”[62]。后来，在讨论“资本利息”时，他强调：“我关注的是真理，而不是我理论的原创性。特别是，我愿意尽可能地以庞巴维克的理论为基础，尽管后者断然拒绝接受任何意见”[158]。

Certainly Schumpeter took special pains to ease the desired transition of his more orthodox colleagues into a new perspective of economic life. The economic theory of the stationary circular flow, he asserted innocently early in Economic Development, “will simply be improved for its own purposes, by building onto it” [61] in constructing a theory of economic development. Moreover, he continued, his theory of development would not ask such broad, historical questions as “what changes of this [developmental] sort have actually made the modern economic system what it is? nor: what are the conditions of such changes? We only ask, and indeed in the same sense as theory always asks: how do such changes take place, and to what economic phenomena do they give rise” [62]? Later, in his discussion of “interest on capital,” he insists, “I am concerned with the truth and not with the originality of my theory. In particular I willingly base it upon that of Böhm-Bawerk as much as possible, however decidedly the latter has declined all communion” [158].

然而，这些努力最终都徒劳无功，正如前一段最后一句的结尾所承认的那样。熊彼特那些较为传统的批评者的尖锐批评往往是夸大其词、不得要领，或是源于对他的论证的误解。例如，庞巴维克对熊彼特利息理论的长篇批判 103 ，重提了庞巴维克一贯的论点：人们系统性地偏好当下而非未来，以及迂回的生产方式能带来更高的生产力，即使在经济稳定的情况下，也能确保正利率 104。庞巴维克由此暗示熊彼特的分析缺乏逻辑连贯性，或者至少缺乏经验现实性。熊彼特友好地回应说，他实际上接受了庞巴维克关于利息的大部分分析。首先，熊彼特指出，伯姆-巴维克关于预期当下价值高于未来价值的著名理由中，他唯一否定的是未来享受被系统性低估的论点，“只要伯姆-巴维克要求我们接受它本身无需任何解释”[158]。其次，如果伯姆-巴维克“严格遵守他‘采用迂回的生产方式’的说法，并且遵循其中蕴含的指示，那么……”创业行为——这是我提出的实施新组合概念的众多从属案例之一。他没有这样做；我相信，借助他自己的分析可以证明，仅仅重复已经实施并纳入循环流程的迂回生产方法不会产生净收入”[159]。

These pains were in vain, however, as is acknowledged by the final phrase in the last sentence of the preceding paragraph. The barbs of Schumpeter’s more conventional critics were often exaggerated, misdirected, or based on misunderstanding of his argument. Böhm-Bawerk’s long critique of Schumpeter’s interest theory,103 for example, returned to Böhm-Bawerk’s familiar contention that a systematic time preference for the present over the future and the greater productivity of roundabout methods of production would ensure a positive rate of interest, even under stationary conditions,104 thus suggesting that Schumpeter’s analysis lacked logical cohesion or at least empirical realism. Schumpeter replied amiably that he actually accepted most of Böhm-Bawerk’s analysis of interest. First, the only one of Böhm-Bawerk’s famous reasons for expecting a premium upon the present over the future which he rejects, Schumpeter tells us, is the argument that future enjoyments are systematically underestimated, “so far as Böhm-Bawerk asks us to accept it as a cause not itself requiring any explanation” [158]. Second, if Böhm-Bawerk “had kept strictly to his expression ‘adoption of roundabout methods of production’ and if he had followed the indication which it contains, this would be an entrepreneurial act—one of the many subordinate cases of my concept of carrying out new combinations. He did not do this; and I believe it can be shown with the help of his own analysis that no net income would flow from the mere repetition of roundabout methods of production which have already been carried out and incorporated in the circular flow” [159].

主流经济学对熊彼特利息理论的批判性回应的第二个例子来自莱昂内尔·罗宾斯。罗宾斯是一位深受奥地利学派影响的著名英国经济学家，他在熊彼特《经济发展》第二版出版几年后提出了这一观点。罗宾斯认为，即使在静态经济中，利息也必然存在，它是资本（生产资料）使用的一种回报。罗宾斯认为，如果资本使用没有收益，人们就没有理由停止消费资本。折旧将被忽略，生产资料会损耗殆尽，循环流动也无法维持。罗宾斯指出，熊彼特的静态分析基于J.B.克拉克的公式，该公式将资本供给“固定不变”。因此，当他提出除非有动态变化否则不存在利息时，他忽略了更广泛的静态均衡概念，也忽视了这样一个事实：如果经济可以自由流动，那么经济的平稳性就取决于利息支付是否处于一定水平。105然而，对熊彼特的分析若有更富同情心的解读，则会颠覆这一论点。也就是说，熊彼特并非像J.B.克拉克那样，一开始就假定资本不变。相反，他是从他对静态经济的构想中推导出这一假设的。多琳·沃里纳在一篇极具洞察力的评论文章中指出：“当牢记静态状态的特殊假设时，罗宾斯教授的批评——即如果资本的使用没有收益，就没有理由停止消费资本——并不会影响这一论点。” 106这些“特殊假设”如前所述，“假设”包括投资的常规化以及不存在对现在而非未来的系统性时间偏好。在这些条件下，相同的收入在不同的时间点会产生相同的效用。因此，例如，试图通过不计提折旧来增加今天的消费，其带来的效用增加将小于明天减少消费所导致的边际效用损失。因此，最经济的解决方案是计提折旧并保持资本水平不变。107

A second example of critical reception to Schumpeter’s interest theory by mainstream economics is that given by Lionel Robbins, a prominent British economist strongly influenced by Austrian perspectives, a few years after publication of the second edition of Economic Development. Robbins argued that interest must exist, even in a stationary economy, as a return for the use of capital (produced means of production). If there were no yield on the use of capital, Robbins contended, there would be no reason to refrain from consuming it. Depreciation would be neglected, produced means of production would wear out, and the circular flow could not be maintained. According to Robbins, Schumpeter based his static analysis upon J.B. Clark’s formulation in which the supply of capital is “held rigid. Then when he comes to argue that there is no interest unless there is dynamic change, ignoring the fact that a wider conception of stationary equilibrium is possible, he is blind to the consideration that if things are free to move, stationariness depends inter alia upon the interest payment being at a certain level.”105 A more sympathetic interpretation of Schumpeter’s analysis, however, would reverse the argument. That is, Schumpeter does not begin (as J.B. Clark did) by assuming constancy of capital. Instead, he deduces it from the conditions of his conception of the stationary economy. “When the special assumptions of the static state are held in mind,” Doreen Warriner observed in a remarkably perceptive review article, “Professor Robbins’s criticism that if there is no yield to the use of capital, there is no reason to refrain from consuming it, does not affect the argument.”106 These “special assumptions,” as noted earlier, include routinization of investment and absence of any systematic time preference for the present over the future. Under these conditions, the same income would yield the same utility at different moments in time. Consequently, an attempt to increase consumption today, by failing to provide for depreciation in one’s business, for example, would gain less increase in satisfaction than the marginal loss in utility from reducing consumption tomorrow. Thus, the most economical solution would be to provide for depreciation and maintain capital at the same level.107

这种解读中蕴含着重要的实践智慧，它将熊彼特与庞巴维克及其他批评者就静止经济利率问题展开的辩论视为偏离主旨的题外话。在静止循环流动中，利率究竟是零还是正但很低，这只是一个无关紧要的小问题，如今看来几乎不值得为此耗费笔墨。 108然而，熊彼特的奥地利学派和新古典主义同时代人有充分的理由对他的论点保持警惕，尽管他们并未明确阐述其理由。熊彼特对经济学正统观念的挑战核心在于其根本性。一旦熊彼特提出了他关于静止经济的全新且非常严谨的概念，即静止经济仅仅涉及对既定条件的适应过程，那么，他关于利率、利润、货币和商业周期需要一个明确的动态演化分析框架的观点便成为一个必然的推论。正如熊彼特后来所言，资本主义是一个动态系统，因此不能用研究静态经济的同一套理论框架来理解它。简而言之，存在两个领域——静态领域和演化领域——需要两种不同的组织原则。熊彼特在1928年指出，由于发展领域的各种现象“相互关联，形成一个连贯且自洽的逻辑整体”，因此“显然有利于……”清晰地阐明它们；将均衡概念、连续曲线和微小的边际变化归入一个独立的理论体系，而所有这些反过来又与恒定数据下的经济常规循环流动相联系；并在此基础上，在考虑“真实”现象的全部复杂性——次级波动、偶然事件、“增长”等等——之前，构建一个资本主义变革理论，并假设非经济条件或数据是恒定且自动的，经济条件不存在渐进变化。” 109正如沃里纳恰当地指出，熊彼特的分析所揭示的正统新古典经济学的弱点不在于其不完整性，“而在于它试图将动态因素强行塞进静态的框架中。” 110熊彼特抛出的这道方法论上的挑战——尽管在《经济发展》一书中，他显然是以一种“温和推销”的方式，试图鼓励那些较为保守的同代人追随他的脚步，从而削弱了这道挑战——对于他那些更为正统的同事来说，仍然是不可接受的。无论如何，这道挑战并未被接受。时至今日，主流经济学本质上仍然是对静态条件的静态分析。“动态模型”作为对经济理论核心静态框架的补充，主要也是“机械论”的，而非发展演化的。即使在发展经济学领域，情况似乎也是如此。发展经济学和产业组织经济学一样，都受到了熊彼特思想的特殊推动。杰弗里·B·纽金特和潘·A·约托普洛斯指出，“发展经济学的主导范式建立在古典-新古典主义的世界观之上，在这个世界观中，变革是渐进的、边际的、非破坏性的、均衡的，并且在很大程度上是渐进的。”无痛的。” 111人们怀疑熊彼特会同意，因为他设想的是快速、大规模、颠覆性的、不平衡的，有时是英勇的但痛苦的社会经济变革。

There is an important element of practical wisdom in the interpretation which regards Schumpeter’s debates with Böhm-Bawerk and other critics over the rate of interest in the stationary economy as digressionary from the main argument. Whether interest rates, in a stationary circular flow, are zero or positive but quite low, is a petty issue which today hardly seems worth the ink that was spilled on it.108 However, Schumpeter’s Austrian and neoclassicist contemporaries had good cause to be wary of his argument, though on grounds which they did not clearly articulate. The core of Schumpeter’s challenge to economic orthodoxy was quite fundamental. Once Schumpeter had provided his new and very austere conception of a stationary economy as one involving merely processes of adaptation to given conditions, his view that interest, profits, money, and business cycles required an expressly dynamic and evolutionary analytical framework followed as an essential corollary. Because capitalism is a dynamic system, as Schumpeter later put it, it cannot be understood with the same theoretical apparatus used for examining the stationary economy. There are, in short, two domains—the stationary and the evolutionary—requiring two different organizing principles. Because the phenomena of the developmental realm “link up so as to form a coherent and self-contained logical whole,” Schumpeter argued in 1928 that “it is obviously conducive to clearness to bring them out boldly; to relegate to one distinct body of doctrine the concept of equilibrium, the continuous curves and small marginal variations, all of which, in their turn, link up with the circuit flow of economic routine under constant data; and to build alongside of this, and before taking account of the full complexity of the ‘real’ phenomenon—secondary waves, chance occurrences, ‘growth’ and so on—a theory of capitalist change, assuming in so doing, that noneconomic conditions or data are constant and automatic and gradual change in economic conditions is absent.”109 As Warriner aptly stated, the weakness of orthodox neoclassical economics exposed by Schumpeter’s analysis lay, not in its incompleteness, “but in its attempt to force dynamic elements into the static mould.”110 This methodological gauntlet thrown down by Schumpeter—however blunted in Economic Development by a “soft sell” evidently designed to encourage the more timid of his contemporaries to follow his lead—was unacceptable to his more orthodox colleagues. In any event, the gauntlet was not picked up. To this day, mainstream economics remains essentially a static analysis of stationary conditions. “Dynamic models” which have supplemented the core static apparatus of economic theory have been mainly “mechanistic” rather than developmental-evolutionary. This appears to be true even in the field of the economics of development, which, like that of the economics of industrial organization, has received special stimulus from Schumpeter’s ideas. According to Jeffrey B. Nugent and Pan A. Yotopoulos, the “ruling paradigm of the economics of development rests on the classical-neoclassical view of a world in which change is gradual, marginalist, non-disruptive, equilibrating, and largely painless.”111 One suspects that Schumpeter, with his vision of rapid, large scale, disruptive, disequilibrating, and at times heroic but painful socioeconomic change, would agree.

正是这种发展演化的方法论和视角构成了其主要遗产。本书探讨了经济发展，这也是我们今天阅读此书的主要原因。狭义上讲，熊彼特的著作对从竞争性资本主义向大企业资本主义转型过程中创新和创业的战略层面进行了富有创造性和想象力的分析。仅凭这一点，就足以确保熊彼特在二十世纪思想史上占有一席之地。更广义地解读，《经济发展》挑战了当代社会理论，要求其构建一个真正具有历史动态性的分析框架，以便更现实、更有效地考察各种社会制度环境下的发展进程，包括发达资本主义国家、共产主义社会和第三世界国家。熊彼特关于经济领导力和内部产生的革命性质变的理论，蕴含着超越其特定历史背景和社会视角的深远意义。

It is precisely this developmental-evolutionary methodology and perspective which constitutes the primary legacy of Economic Development and the major reason for reading the book today. Perceived narrowly, Schumpeter’s work gives a creative and imaginative analysis of strategic aspects of innovation and entrepreneurship in the process of transition from competitive capitalism to big-business capitalism. This accomplishment alone should ensure Schumpeter’s niche in the intellectual history of the twentieth century. Interpreted more broadly, Economic Development challenges contemporary social theory to construct a genuine, historically dynamic, analytical structure for more realistically and fruitfully examining processes of development in various socio-institutional settings, including advanced capitalism, the Communist societies, and the Third World. Schumpeter’s conceptualizations of economic leadership and internally-generated processes of revolutionary, qualitative change are pregnant with implications transcending his own particular historical setting and social perspective.

笔记

Notes

1.该书德文首版于1911年秋季出版，版权年份为1912年，书名为《Thieorie tier wirtsciia/tliclien Entwicklung》。 1926年出版了德文第二版，该版本在阐述方面有所修改，但内容并无重大变化。1934年，哈佛大学出版社出版了由雷德弗斯·奥皮（Redvers Opie）翻译的英文版，该译本基于德文第三版，而德文第三版实际上只是第二版的重印本。

1. The book appeared in its first German edition in the fall of 1911, with a 1912 publisher’s copyright, under the title Thieorie tier wirtsciia/tliclien Entwicklung. A second German edition, incorporating expository alterations but no significant substantive changes, appeared in 1926. The English translation, by Redvers Opie, made from a third German edition that was merely a reprint of the second edition, was published by Harvard University Press in 1934.

2.参见戈特弗里德·哈伯勒 (Gottfried Haberler) 对熊彼特对其老师庞巴维克 (Böhm-Bawerk) 的传记评论的讨论 (“Das wissenschaftliche Lebenswerk Eugen von Böhm-Bawerks,” in Zeitsclirift für I'olkswirtscliaft, Vienna, 1914, 454-528)，参见“Joseph Alois Schumpeter, 1883-1950”，《经济学季刊》， 1950 年 8 月，重印于 Seymour E. Harris 编辑，《熊彼特：社会科学家》（剑桥：哈佛大学出版社，1951 年），24-17。引文出现在第 28 页。熊彼特关于庞巴维克的文章的英文节译本收录于熊彼特去世后出版的《从马克思到凯恩斯的十大经济学家》（纽约：牛津大学出版社，1951 年），第 143-190 页。在同一来源中，另见熊彼特关于卡尔·门格尔的文章，第 87 页。

2. See Gottfried Haberler’s discussion of Schumpeter’s biographical commentary on his teacher Böhm-Bawerk (“Das wissenschaftliche Lebenswerk Eugen von Böhm-Bawerks,” in Zeitsclirift für I’olkswirtscliaft, Vienna, 1914, 454-528), in “Joseph Alois Schumpeter, 1883-1950,” Quarterly Journal of Economics, August 1950, reprinted in Seymour E. Harris, ed., Schumpeter: Social Scientist (Cambridge: Harvard University Press, 1951), 24-17. The cited phrase appears on 28. An abridged English translation of Schumpeter’s essay on Böhm-Bawerk appears in Schumpeter’s posthumously published Ten Great Economists from Marx to Keynes (New York: Oxford University Press, 1951), 143-90. In the same source, see also Schumpeter’s essay on Carl Menger, 87.

3. Joseph A. Schumpeter，“约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯，1883-1946”，《美国经济评论》， 1946年9月。转载于 Seymour E. Harris，ed.，《新经济学：凯恩斯对理论和公共政策的影响》（纽约：阿尔弗雷德·A·克诺夫出版社，1952 年），第 73-101 页。引用的章节出现在第 80 页。

3. Joseph A. Schumpeter, “John Maynard Keynes, 1883-1946,” American Economic Review, September 1946. Reprinted in Seymour E. Harris, ed., The New Economics: Keynes’ Influence on Theory and Public Policy (New York: Alfred A. Knopf, 1952), 73-101. The section cited appears on 80.

4.阿瑟·斯皮瑟夫 (Arthur Spiethoff)，“约瑟夫·熊彼特 (Josef Schumpeter)，悼念” ，Kyklos，卷。 3、1949 年，290。

4. Arthur Spiethoff, “Josef Schumpeter, In Memoriam,” Kyklos, Vol. 3, 1949, 290.

5.熊彼特，《Das Wesen and der Hauptiiihalt der tlieoretisclten Nationalkonomie》，莱比锡：1908 年。

5. Schumpeter, Das Wesen and der Hauptiiihalt der tlieoretisclten Nationalkonomie, Leipzig: 1908.

7. Spiethoff，“约瑟夫·熊彼特纪念文集”，291。

7. Spiethoff, “Josef Schumpeter, In Memoriam,” 291.

8. Arthur Smithies，“纪念：约瑟夫·阿洛伊斯·熊彼特，1883-1950”，《美国经济评论》， 1950 年。转载于 Seymour E. Harris 编辑的《熊彼特：社会科学家》，第 11-23 页。

8. Arthur Smithies, “Memorial: Joseph Alois Schumpeter, 1883-1950,” American Economic Review, 1950. Reprinted in Seymour E. Harris, ed., Schumpeter: Social Scientist, 11-23.

9.哈伯勒，“Das wissenschaftliche Lebenswerk”，27。

9. Haberler, “Das wissenschaftliche Lebenswerk,” 27.

10. Stanley W. Jevons, Theory of Political Economy (New York: Kelley and Millman, 1957) [1871]. Carl Menger, Principles of Economics, trans. James Dingwall and Bert F. Hoselitz (Glencoe, Ill.: The Free Press, 1950), [1871]. Léon Walras, Elements of Pure Economics, trans. William Jaffe (Homewood, Ill.: Richard D. Irwin, Inc., 1954) [1874].

11. GLS Shackle，《高理论的年代：经济理论的发明与传统，1926-1929》（伦敦：剑桥大学出版社，1967 年）。

11. G.L.S. Shackle, The Years of High Theory: Invention and Tradition in Economic Theory, 1926-1929 (London: Cambridge University Press, 1967).

12. Piero Sraffa，“竞争条件下的收益规律”，《经济学杂志》，第 36 卷，1926 年 12 月，535-50 页。

12. Piero Sraffa, “The Laws of Returns under Competitive Conditions,” Economic Journal, Vol. 36, December 1926, 535-50.

13. Joan Robinson，《不完全竞争经济学》（伦敦：麦克米伦出版社，1961 年）[1933 年]。Edward H. Chamberlin，《垄断竞争理论：价值理论的重新定位》，第 8 版（剑桥：哈佛大学出版社，1962 年）[1933 年]。

13. Joan Robinson, The Economics of Imperfect Competition (London: Macmillan, 1961) [1933]. Edward H. Chamberlin, The Theory of Monopolistic Competition: A Re-orientation of the Theory of Value, 8th ed. (Cambridge: Harvard University Press, 1962) [1933].

14. John R. Hicks，《价值与资本》（伦敦：牛津大学出版社，1939 年）。

14. John R. Hicks, Value and Capital (London: Oxford University Press, 1939).

15. John R. Commons，《资本主义的法律基础》（纽约：麦克米伦出版社，1934 年）；《制度经济学：其在政治经济学中的地位》（纽约：麦克米伦出版社，1934 年）。

15. John R. Commons, Legal Foundations of Capitalism (New York: Macmillan, 1934); Institutional Economics: Its Place in Political Economy (New York: Macmillan, 1934).

16.约翰·M·凯恩斯，《货币论》（纽约：哈考特·布雷斯出版社，1930 年）；《就业、利息和货币通论》（纽约：哈考特·布雷斯出版社，1936 年）。

16. John M. Keynes, A Treatise on Money (New York: Harcourt Brace, 1930); The General Theory of Employment, Interest, and Money (New York: Harcourt Brace, 1936).

17. Business Cycles: A Theoretical, Historical and Statistical Analysis of the Capitalist Process (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1939).

18. 资本主义、社会主义和民主（纽约：哈珀和罗出版社，1950 年）[1942 年]。

18. Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy (New York: Harper and Row, 1950) [1942].

19.参见JA Schumpeter文集， Richard V. Clemence编（剑桥：Addison-Wesley出版社，1951年）。

19. See Essays of J.A. Schumpeter, Richard V. Clemence, ed. (Cambridge: Addison-Wesley Press, 1951).

20.括号内的所有页码均指本期《经济发展》期刊。

20. All page numbers in parentheses refer to this Transaction edition of Economic Development.

21.熊彼特在《经济发展》日文版序言中区分了“静态”和“平稳” 。“静态理论仅仅是对均衡条件和……的陈述。”这种均衡方式是指在每次微小扰动后，均衡状态倾向于重新建立起来。这种理论可用于研究任何类型的现实，无论其多么失衡。然而，平稳过程实际上并不会主动改变，而只是随着时间的推移，不断地复制恒定的实际收入率。如果它发生变化，那也是在自身外部事件的影响下发生的，例如自然灾害、战争等等。”引自克莱门斯编，《熊彼特文集》，第159页。

21. Schumpeter distinguished between “static” and “stationary” in the preface to the Japanese edition of Economic Development. “A static theory is simply a statement of the conditions of equilibrium and of the way in which equilibrium tends to re-establish itself after every small disturbance. Such a theory can be useful in the investigation of any kind of reality, however disequilibrated it may be. A stationary process, however, is a process which actually does not change of its own initiative, but merely reproduces constant rates of real income as it flows along in time. If it changes at all, it does so under the influence of events which are external to itself, such as natural catastrophes, wars and so on.” Cited in Clemence, ed., Essays of J.A. Schumpeter, 159.

22.保罗·斯威齐在他的熊彼特论文中很好地总结了这一点：“每个人都平等地获得‘资本’。” 在这种情况下，显然，“雇主不可能获得剩余价值；因为如果雇主获得了剩余价值，劳动者自己就会取代雇主，并通过竞争来夺走剩余价值。” 保罗·M·斯威齐，《作为历史的现在》（纽约：每月评论出版社，1953 年），第 277 页。

22. Paul Sweezy summarizes this point well in his essay on Schumpeter: “Everyone has equal access to ‘capital.’” Under these circumstances, clearly, “no surpluses can accrue to employers of labor; for if they did, the laborers would themselves turn employers and compete the surplus away,” Paul M. Sweezy, The Present as History (New York: Monthly Review Press, 1953), 277.

23.熊彼特的一些早期德国著作显示了克拉克思想的强烈影响，这种影响在经济发展中持续存在。其中不包括“克拉克教授的分配理论”（“克拉克教授的Verteilungstheorie”，1906）和“美国的最新经济理论”（“Die neuere Wirtschaftstheorie in den Vereinigten Staaten”，Schmellers Jahrbuch， 1910）。

23. Several of Schumpeter’s early German works show a strong influence of Clark’s ideas, an influence continuing in Economic Development. Not able among these are “Professor Clark’s Theory of Distribution” (“Professor Clark’s Verteilungstheorie,” 1906) and “Recent Economic Theory in the United States” (“Die neuere Wirtschaftstheorie in den Vereinigten Staaten,” Schmellers Jahrbuch, 1910).

24.熊彼特在1937年为日文版《经济发展》所作的序言中，表达了他对瓦尔拉斯深厚的学术渊源：“瓦尔拉斯为我们提供了一个经济体系的概念和一套理论框架，这套框架在经济学史上首次有效地涵盖了经济量之间相互依存的纯粹逻辑。”（引自克莱门斯编，《熊彼特文集》 ，第159页）。在同一文献中，熊彼特指出，“作为一名经济学家”，他受瓦尔拉斯的“概念和方法……的影响远胜于其他任何影响”。四年后，在一篇关于阿尔弗雷德·马歇尔的文章中，他称瓦尔拉斯为“所有理论家中最伟大的一位”。（熊彼特，《马歇尔的原理：半个世纪的评价》，《美国经济评论》， 1941年6月，第239页）

24. Schumpeter expressed his strong intellectual debt to Walras in his preface to the Japanese edition of Economic Development, in 1937: “To Walras we owe a concept of the economic system and a theoretical apparatus which for the first time in the history of our science effectively embraced the pure logic of the interdependence between economic quantities.” Cited in Clemence, ed., Essays of J.A. Schumpeter, 159. In the same source, Schumpeter stated that “as an economist,” he owed more to “the Walrasian conception and the Walrasian technique … than to any other influence.” Four years later, in an essay on Alfred Marshall, he called Walras “the greatest of all theorists.” Schumpeter, “Marshall’s Principles: A Semi-Centennial Appraisal,” American Economic Review, June 1941, 239.

25.熊彼特以与瓦拉斯大致相似的方式论证道，在稳定的均衡条件下，“不存在一个阶级，其特征是拥有生产资料或消费品……如果我们选择将企业的经理或所有者称为‘企业家’，那么他将是一个既无特殊职能也无特殊收入的企业家。如果将生产资料的拥有者称为‘资本家’，那么他们只能是生产者，与其他生产者没有任何区别，并且与其他生产者一样，只能以高于工资和租金总和的成本的价格出售他们的产品”[45-46]。

25. Under stationary equilibrium conditions, Schumpeter argues, in a manner roughly paralleling Walas before him, “there is no class whose characteristic is that they possess produced means of production or consumption goods …. If we choose to call the manager or owner of a business ‘entrepreneur,’ then he would be an entrepreneur faisant ni benefice ni perte, without special function and without income of a special kind. If the possessors of produced means of production were called ‘capitalists,’ then they could only be producers, differing in nothing from other producers, and could no more than the others sell their products above the costs given by the total of wages and rents” [45-46].

26.哈耶克，“经济学与知识”，《经济学》， 1937 年，第 33-54 页。重印于《个人主义与经济秩序》（芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1948 年），第 33-56 页。

26. Hayek, “Economics and Knowledge,” Economica, 1937, 33-54. Reprinted in Individualism and Economic Order (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1948), 33-56.

27.帕累托，《政治经济学手册》[1906]，美国版，安·S·施维尔（纽约：奥古斯都·M·凯利，1971 年），259-63。

27. Pareto, Manual of Political Economy [1906], American edition, Ann S. Schwier (New York: Augustus M. Kelley, 1971), 259-63.

28.熊彼特，《商业周期：资本主义过程的理论、历史和统计分析》，第 1 卷（纽约：麦格劳-希尔出版社，1939 年），第 68-71 页。

28. Schumpeter, Business Cycles: A Theoretical, Historical, and Statistical Analysis of the Capitalist Process, vol. 1 (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1939), 68-71.

29.熊彼特，《资本主义、社会主义和民主》，第62页。

29. Schumpeter, Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy, 62.

30.熊彼特认为资本主义是一个演化过程，因此他坚持认为，必须从长期发展动力的角度来评估资本主义以及商业企业的短期市场策略。他后来指出，真正“相关的问题”不是“资本主义如何管理现有结构”，而是“它如何创造和摧毁这些结构”。同上，第84页。

30. Consistent with his view of capitalism as an evolutionary process, Schumpeter insisted that it, and the short-run market strategies of business enterprises, must be appraised in terms of a perspective of long-run developmental dynamism. The really “relevant problem,” lie later noted, is not “how capitalism administers existing structures,” but “how it creates and destroys them.” Ibid., 84.

31.这一关键的方法论观点至少得到了《经济发展》一书早期部分评论者的认可。例如，R.C. McCrea 对此做了很好的总结：“人们对熊彼特的静态分析的第一反应是感到恼火。这种处理方式如此不切实际，如此纯粹是思维体操，以至于给人一种纯粹的逻辑推理的印象。但熊彼特本人承认其纯粹是假设性的，甚至试图以此为由为其辩护……在通常的静态解释中，人们过分强调了由此产生的原则体系是一个有血有肉的实体。熊彼特通过其分析的严谨性和对数据进行严格限制的勇气，真正地打破了这种观点。其结果实际上是一种归谬法—— ‘极端假设法在经济学中的应用’。”然而，麦克雷接着指出，这种方法具有启发性，并且“更有可能取得丰硕成果”，正是因为它将永恒的变化过程置于一个明确阐述的发展理论框架之内。麦克雷，《熊彼特的经济体系》，《经济学季刊》， 1913年5月，527-28页。

31. This key methodological point was appreciated by at least some ol the early reviewers of Economic Development. R.C. McCrea, for example, summarized this matter well: “One’s first reaction toward his [Schumpeter’s] static analysis is a feeling of vexation. The treatment is so unreal, so like pure mental gymnastic, that it makes the impression of mere logomachy. But Schumpeter himself admits its purely hypothetical quality, nay, seeks to justify it on this ground…. In the usual static interpretation there has been too large an implication that the resulting body of principle is a creature of live flesh and bones. Schumpeter, by the rigor of his analysis and the courage with which he has restricted his data, really disembodies this view. The result is virtually a reductio ad absurdum “the method of extreme hypothesis as applied to economics.” This method, however, McCrea proceeds to observe, is suggestive and is “much more likely to yield fruitful results” precisely because it places the perennial process of change within the domain of an expressly formulated theory of development. McCrea, “Schumpeter’s Economic System,” Quarterly Journal of Economics, May 1913, 527-28.

32.因此，创新应与“发明”（即使发明人和创新者是同一人）区分开来，尤其当发明仅限于机械或技术性质的新想法时。创新涉及（1）任何新想法的商业应用。

32. Innovation thus is to be distinguished from “invention” (even where inventor and innovator are the same person), especially when invention is restricted to new ideas of a mechanical or technical nature. Innovation involves the (1) commercial application of (2) any new idea.

33.熊彼特，《资本主义、社会主义和民主》，第 83 页。

33. Schumpeter, Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy, 83.

34. “从任何意义上说，企业家的特征动机都不是享乐主义的，即，不能通过消费商品来满足……从享乐主义的角度来看，……我们通常在企业家身上观察到的行为是不理性的”[92]。

34. “[I]n no sense is his [the entrepreneur’s] characteristic motivation of the hedonist kind [i.e.,] capable of being satisfied by the consumption of goods…. Hedonistically, … the conduct which we usually observe in [entrepreneurs] would be irrational” [92].

35.庞巴维克，《资本实证论》 [1889]。威廉·斯马特，译。 （纽约：GE Stechert，1891），20。

35. Böhm-Bawerk, The Positive Theory of Capital [1889]. William Smart, trans. (New York: G.E. Stechert, 1891), 20.

36. “因此，应当清楚地理解，每当生产函数本身发生变化时，我们就遇到了由科学带来的技术进步；每当由土地服务构成的生产系数下降而由资本服务构成的生产系数上升，而生产函数本身没有变化时，我们就遇到了由储蓄带来的经济进步。” 莱昂·瓦尔拉斯，《纯粹经济学原理》 [1874]。威廉·贾菲译（伦敦：艾伦和昂温出版社，1954），386。

36. “It should, therefore, be clearly understood that every time the production function itself undergoes a change, we have a case of technical progress brought about by science and that every time the coefficients on production made up of land-services decrease while those of capital-services increase without any change in the production function, we have a case of economic progress resulting from saving.” Leon Walras, Elements of Pure Economics [1874]. William Jaffe, trans. (London: Allen and Unwin, 1954), 386.

37. Mohd. Shabbir Khan，《熊彼特的资本主义发展理论》（德里：穆斯林大学，1957 年），第 54-55 页。

37. Mohd. Shabbir Khan, Schumpeter’s Theory of Capitalist Development (Delhi: Muslim University, 1957), 54-55.

38.见 Clemence 编，《熊彼特文集》，第 159 页。

38. In Clemence, ed., Essays of J.A. Schumpeter, 159.

39.同上，第 160 页。

39. Ibid., 160.

40.熊彼特在《经济发展》第二版出版后不久便指出，在“竞争性资本主义”中，创新“通常体现在新企业的创立和产业家族的崛起……而这一切在‘托拉斯化’资本主义中则截然不同”，创新发生在“现有的大型企业内部”，进步变得“自动化”，日益非人为化，越来越少地依赖于领导力和个人主动性。熊彼特，《资本主义的不稳定性》，《经济学杂志》， 1928年9月，第361-386页。转载于克莱门斯编，《熊彼特文集》，引文出自第70-71页。

40. In “competitive capitalism,” Schumpeter observed shortly after publication of the second edition of Economic Development, innovation is “typically embodied in the foundation of new firms [and] the rise of industrial families…. All this is different in ‘trustified’ capitalism” where innovation occurs “within the big units now existing” and where progress becomes “‘automatized,’ increasingly impersonal and decreasingly a matter of leadership and individual initiative.” Schumpeter, “The Instability of Capitalism,” Economic Journal, September 1928, 361-86. Reprinted in Clemence, ed., Essays of J.A. Schumpeter, quotations from 70-71.

41.例如，R.C. McCrea，《经济发展》的早期评论者，在表达对熊彼特著作的赞赏时，也指出企业家是“经济演进的积极推动者”。熊彼特因此对经济进步提出了一种超人的解释，其主要轮廓与加布里埃尔·塔尔德的社会学体系非常相似。C.C. McCrea，“熊彼特的经济体系”，526。

41. R.C. McCrea, for example, an early reviewer of Economic Development, tempered his clear admiration for Schumpeter’s work by observing that entrepreneurial individuals are the “active agents of economic evolution. Schumpeter thus offers a superman interpretation of economic progress, in main outline quite analogous to the sociological system of Gabriel Tarde.” Cl. McCrea, “Schumpeter’s Economic System,”526.

42.参见脚注 28。另请参阅 Rendigs Fels 节选的单卷本《商业周期》 （纽约：麦格劳-希尔出版社，1964 年）。

42. See Footnote 28. See also the useful one-volume edition, Business Cycles, abridged by Rendigs Fels (New York: McGraw-Hill, 1964).

43.熊彼特，《商业周期》，第 1 卷，第 137 页。

43. Schumpeter, Business Cycles, vol. 1, 137.

45.同上。

45. Ibid.

46.参见脚注16。

46. See Footnote 16.

49. Schumpeter, Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy, 85.

50. Richard V. Clemence 和 Francis S. Doody，《熊彼特体系》（剑桥：Addison-Wesley，1950 年），第 13 页。

51.熊彼特，《商业周期》，第 1 卷，第 150 页。

52.同上，第 173 页。

52. Ibid, 173.

53. Herbert von Beckerath，“约瑟夫·A·熊彼特作为社会学家”，载于 Harris 编，《熊彼特：社会科学家》，第 112 页。

53. Herbert von Beckerath, “Joseph A. Schumpeter as a Sociologist,” in Harris, ed., Schumpeter: Social Scientist, 112.

54.凡勃伦的《企业理论》（纽约：查尔斯·斯克里布纳之子出版社，1904年）和康芒斯的《制度经济学》（麦迪逊：威斯康星大学出版社，1961年）是这一观点的代表作。另见笔者的评论文章《制度主义作为政治经济学的进路》，载《经济问题杂志》， 1978年3月，第91-114页。

54. Veblen, Theory of Business Enterprise (New York: Charles Scribner’s Sons, 1904) and Commons, Institutional Economics [1934] (Madison: University of Wisconsin Press, 1961) are representative writings of this perspective. See also the present author’s review essay, “Institutionalism as an Approach to Political Economy,” Journal of Economic Issues, March 1978, 91-114.

55.最初以“Zur Soziologie der Imperialismus”为标题出版，Archiv für Sozialwissenschaft and Sozialpolitik（图宾根：1919），卷。 46、1-39、275-310；和“Die sozialen Klassen im ethnisch homienen Milieu”，Archiv für Sozialwisssenschaft und Sozialpolitik（图宾根：1927），卷。 57、1-67。这些文章由海因茨·诺登 (Heinz Norden) 翻译成英文，附有熊彼特的一位杰出学生保罗·M·斯威齐 (Paul M. Sweezy) 的编辑介绍，他是当代马克思主义经济学家、《每月评论》的编辑。帝国主义和社会阶级（纽约：Augustus M. Kelley，1951）。

55. Originally published under the titles “Zur Soziologie der Imperialismus,” Archiv für Sozialwissenschaft and Sozialpolitik (Tubingen: 1919), vol. 46, 1-39, 275-310; and “Die sozialen Klassen im ethnisch homogenen Milieu,” Archiv für Sozialwisssenschaft und Sozialpolitik (Tubingen: 1927), vol. 57, 1-67. An English translation of these essays, made by Heinz Norden, is available with an editor’s introduction by one of Schumpeter’s prominent students, Paul M. Sweezy, contemporary Marxist economist and editor of Monthly Review. Imperialism and Social Classes (New York: Augustus M. Kelley, 1951).

56.熊彼特，《经济分析史》（纽约：牛津大学出版社，1954 年）。

56. Schumpeter, History of Economic Analysis (New York: Oxford University Press, 1954).

57.例如，参见本文作者的《马克思和熊彼特论资本主义的创造性破坏》，《经济学季刊》， 1980 年 8 月，第 45-68 页；以及 Overton H. Taylor 的《熊彼特和马克思：熊彼特体系中的帝国主义和社会阶级》，《经济学季刊》， 1951 年 11 月，第 525-55 页。

57. See, e.g., the present author’s “Marx and Schumpeter on Capitalism’s Creative Destruction,” Quarterly Journal of Economics, August 1980, 45-68; and Overton H. Taylor, “Schumpeter and Marx: Imperialism and Social Classes in the Schumpeterian System,” Quarterly Journal of Economics, November 1951, 525-55.

58. “社会学和经济学中的《共产党宣言》”，《政治经济学杂志》， 1949 年 6 月，199-212；载于 Earl Hamilton、Albert Rees 和 Harry Johnson合著的《政治经济学里程碑》，第 2 卷（芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1962 年），337-58；引文出自第 345 页。

60.熊彼特，《资本主义、社会主义与民主》，第20页。

60. Schumpeter, Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy, 20.

61.庞巴维克，《卡尔·马克思及其体系的终结》（伦敦：昂温出版社，1898 年）。庞巴维克曾精辟地指出，马克思有过去，有现在，但肯定没有未来。

61. Böhm-Bawerk, Karl Marx and the Close of his System (London: Unwin, 1898). Böhm-Bawerk was the author of the epigrammatic observation that Marx had a past, a present, but certainly no future.

62.熊彼特，“约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯：1883-1946”，《美国经济评论》， 1946 年 9 月。转载于哈里斯主编的《新经济学》，第 92-93 页。

62. Schumpeter, “John Maynard Keynes: 1883-1946,” American Economic Review, September 1946. Reprinted in Harris, ed., The New Economics, 92-93.

63.除了这种核心的分析和方法论批判之外，毫无疑问，还有重要的意识形态、气质和个人因素影响了熊彼特对凯恩斯的态度。在意识形态上，熊彼特称凯恩斯通过对总需求的分析和对过度储蓄的批判，彻底“粉碎了资产阶级论证的最后一根支柱”，而过度储蓄的根本原因在于收入分配不均（同上，99页）。在性格上，凯恩斯主要关注公共政策，着眼于当下的短期问题，并倾向于根据眼前的难题和未来的政策解决方案来构建理论分析。相比之下，熊彼特，尤其是在1926年重返学术界之后，则是一位分析型的唯美主义者，对理论分析本身感兴趣，并倾向于关注政策和制度变革的长期后果。就个人而言，熊彼特对凯恩斯1930年出版的《货币论》 “所有基本思想”的出现深感失望，因为凯恩斯的《货币论》几乎同时出版，抢先发表了熊彼特当时正在撰写的《货币与流通》一书，这迫使他不得不放弃对《货币与流通》的深入研究。熊彼特放弃出版手稿，剥夺了他“多年劳动的成果”。埃里希·施耐德，《约瑟夫·A·熊彼特》 一位伟大社会科学家的生活和工作， W.E. Kuhn 译，（林肯：商业研究局，1975 年），33-34。

63. In addition to this central analytical and methodological critique, there were no doubt important ideological, temperamental, and personal factors which affected Schumpeter’s attitude toward Keynes. Ideologically, Keynes is described by Schumpeter as having “smashed … into dust … the last pillar of the bourgeois argument” by his analysis of aggregate demand and critique of excessive saving, caused fundamentally by an unequal distribution of income (Ibid., 99. Temperamentally, Keynes was preeminently interested in public policy, concerned with short-run problems of the day, and disposed to construct theoretical analyses in the light of immediate problems and prospective policy solutions. Schumpeter, by contrast, especially after his return to academic life in 1926, was a sort of analytical esthete, interested in theoretical analysis in its own right, and inclined to focus on the longer-run consequences of changes in policies and institutions. Personally, Schumpeter was deeply disappointed by the fact that the publication of Keynes’s Treatise on Money, in 1930, anticipated “all the essential ideas” of a volume on “Money and Currency” which Shcumpeter was in the process of completing at about the same time, thus forcing Schumpeter to abandon publication of the manuscript and robbing him “of the fruits of many years’ labor.” Erich Schneider, Joseph A. Schumpeter: Life and Work of a Great Social Scientist, trans. W.E. Kuhn, (Lincoln: Bureau of Business Research, 1975), 33-34.

64.熊彼特，“约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯：1883-1946”，哈里斯编，《熊彼特：社会科学家》，第99页。

64. Schumpeter, “John Maynard Keynes: 1883-1946,” Harris, ed., Schumpeter: Social Scientist, 99.

65. Schumpeter, “The Explanation of the Business Cycle,” Economica, December 1927, 286-311. Reprinted in Clemence, ed., Essays of J.A. Schumpeter, 21-46. The citation appears on 29.

82. Smithies，“纪念：约瑟夫·阿洛伊斯·熊彼特，1883-1950”，载于 Harris 编，《熊彼特：社会科学家》，第 12 页。

87.哈根，《社会变迁理论：经济增长的开端》（伊利诺伊州霍姆伍德：多尔西出版社，1962年）。哈根明确地表达了他对熊彼特的敬意，如下：“现在毫无疑问，技术创新对生产率增长的贡献远大于资本形成。这一点对于第一位伟大的现代经济增长研究者熊彼特来说显而易见”（49）。事实上，哈根认为，熊彼特的论断——即对现有资源的创新性重新配置，也就是“用它们做新的事情”，完全掩盖了“国民生产资料和储蓄供给随时间缓慢而持续的增长……”[68]——“是正确的”。不仅在某种模糊的定性意义上，而且在明确的定量意义上””（49）。

87. Hagen, On the Theory oj Social Change: How Economic Growth Begins (Homewood, Ill: The Dorsey Press, 1962). Hagen expresses his debt to Schumpeter pointedly as follows: “Now it is clear beyond any question that technological creativity is responsible for a far greater share of increase in productivity than is capital formation. This was apparent to the first great modern student of economic growth, Schumpeter” (49). Indeed, Hagen argues, Schumpeter’s statement—that innovative redeployment of existing resources, that is, “doing new things with them,” completely overshadows the “slow and continuous increase in time of the national supply of productive means and savings …” [68]—“is true not merely in some vague qualitative way but also in a definite quantitative sense” (49).

88. Nelson，“制造业国际生产率差异的扩散模型”，《美国经济评论》， 1968 年 12 月，1219-48 页。

88. Nelson, “A Diffusion Model of International Productivity Differences in Manufacturing Industry,” American Economic Review, December 1968, 1219-48.

89. Haberler，“约瑟夫·阿洛伊斯·熊彼特：1883-1950”，载于 Harris 编，《熊彼特：社会科学家》，第 45 页。

89. Haberler, “Joseph Alois Schumpeter: 1883-1950,” in Harris, ed., Schumpeter: Social Scientist, 45.

90.同上，第 47 页。

90. Ibid., 47.

91. Smithies，“纪念：约瑟夫·阿洛伊斯·熊彼特，1883-1950”，第15页。哈伯勒指出，熊彼特的所有课程“都存在一个缺陷：即使听了熊彼特的讲座，学习了他的阅读材料和建议，也永远无法发现他本人曾就这些主题撰写过任何著作。”参见第39页。另见保罗·A·萨缪尔森，“熊彼特作为教师和经济理论家”，载于哈里斯编，《熊彼特：社会科学家》，第52页。

91. Smithies, “Memorial: Joseph Alois Schumpeter, 1883-1950,” 15. All of Schumpeter’s courses, Haberler observes, “suffererd from one defect: by listening to Schumpeter’s lectures and studying his reading assignments and suggestions one could have never found out that he himself had ever written anything on these subjects.” Cf. 39. See also Paul A. Samuelson, “Schumpeter as a Teacher and Economic Theorist,” in Harris, ed., Schumpeter: Social Scientist, 52.

92.熊彼特，《从马克思到凯恩斯的十大经济学家》，第149页。

92. Schumpeter, Ten Great Economists from Marx to Keynes, 149.

93.同上，第 172 页。

93. Ibid., 172.

94.同上，第 76 页。

94. Ibid., 76.

95.同上，第 88 页。

95. Ibid., 88.

96.同上，97、102-04。

96. Ibid., 97, 102-04.

97.同上，287-90。

97. Ibid., 287-90.

98. RA Gordon，载于 Joseph Dorfman 等人，《制度经济学：重新思考凡勃伦、康芒斯和米切尔》（伯克利：加州大学出版社，1963 年），第 146 页。

98. R.A. Gordon, in Joseph Dorfman, et al., Institutional Economics: Veblen, Commons, and Mitchell Reconsidered (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1963), 146.

99. Allan G. Gruchy，《当代经济思想：新制度经济学的贡献》（克利夫顿：奥古斯都·M·凯利，1972 年），第 44 页；《现代经济思想：美国的贡献》（纽约：普伦蒂斯-霍尔，1947 年）。

99. Allan G. Gruchy, Contemporary Economic Thought: The Contribution of Neoinstitutional Economics (Clifton: Augustus M. Kelley, 1972), 44; Modern Economic Thought: The American Contribution (New York: Prentice-Hall, 1947).

100.关于凯恩斯和熊彼特理论要素的综合可能性，参见 EG Bennion，“熊彼特和凯恩斯理论中的失业问题”，《美国经济评论》， 1943 年 6 月，第 336-47 页；以及 Arthur Smithies，“熊彼特和凯恩斯”，载于 Harris 编，《新经济学》，第 136-42 页。

100. On the possibility of synthesizing elements of Keynes’s and Schumpeter’s theories, see E.G. Bennion, “Unemployment in the Theories of Schumpeter and Keynes,” American Economic Review, June 1943, 336-47; and Arthur Smithies, “Schumpeter and Keynes,” in Harris, ed., The New Economics, pp. 136-42.

101. Smithies，“纪念：约瑟夫·阿洛伊斯·熊彼特，1883-1950”，12。

101. Smithies, “Memorial: Joseph Alois Schumpeter, 1883-1950,” 12.

102. Clemence 和 Doody，《熊彼特体系》，第 30 页。

102. Clemence and Doody, The Schumpeterian System, 30.

103.庞巴维克，“资本论的动态”，Zeitschriftfür Volkswirtschaft Sozialpolitik und Venualtung，卷。 1913 年 12 月 22 日。本书还包括熊彼特的答复和庞巴维克的反驳。

103. Böhm-Bawerk, “Eine ‘dynamische’ Theorie des Kapitaliizmus,” Zeitschriftfür Volkswirtschaft Sozialpolitik und Venualtung, vol. 22, 1913. This volume also includes a reply by Schumpeter and a rejoinder by Böhm-Bawerk.

104.在《资本的实证理论》第 252 页及后续章节中，庞巴维克曾给出三个理由来解释为何现在比未来更受重视：（1）现在和未来的需求和需求的供给条件不同（例如，年轻人预期未来收入更高）；（2）由于缺乏想象力和意志力以及生命短暂，人们系统性地低估了未来；（3）更迂回或更耗时的生产方式具有更高的生产力。

104. In The Positive Theory of Capital, 252 ff., Böhm-Bawerk had earlier given three reasons for a premium on present over future: (1) different conditions of wants and provision of wants between present and future (e.g., anticipation of higher future income by the young); (2) systematic underestimation of the future because of lack of imagination arid will and shortness of life; (3) the greater productivity of more roundabout or more time-consuming methods of production.

105. Robbins，“论平稳均衡概念中的某种歧义”，《经济学杂志》， 1930 年 6 月，213-14 页。

105. Robbins, “On a Certain Ambiguity in the Conception of Stationary Equilibrium,” Economic Journal, June 1930, 213-14.

106. Warriner，“熊彼特与静态均衡”，《经济学杂志》， 1931 年 3 月，第 41 页脚注。

106. Warriner, “Schumpeter and Static Equilibrium,” Economic Journal, March 1931, 41n.

107. Clemence 和 Doody，《熊彼特体系》，第 28-29 页。Paul A. Samuelson，“动态、静态和平稳状态”，《经济统计评论》， 1943 年 2 月。

107. Clemence and Doody, The Schumpeterian System, 28-29. Paul A. Samuelson, “Dynamics, Statics, and the Stationary State,” Review of Economic Statistics, February 1943.

108.熊彼特对门格尔思想所受到的反应的抱怨与他自己的经历大致相似：“因此，基本的东西被接受了，但这种接受并没有伴随着感激的认可，而是基于次要问题的形式上的拒绝。”《从马克思到凯恩斯的十大经济学家》，第89页。

108. Schumpeter’s complaint about reaction to Menger’s ideas roughly parallels his own experience: “Thus the essential things were accepted, but this acceptance was accompanied not by grateful acknowledgment, but instead by formal rejection based on subsidiary-issues.” Ten Great Economists from Marx to Keynes, 89.

109.熊彼特，《资本主义的不稳定性》，《经济学杂志》， 1928 年 9 月，载于克莱门斯编，《熊彼特文集》，第 69 页。

109. Schumpeter, “The Instability of Capitalism,” Economic Journal, September 1928, in Clemence, ed., Essays of J.A. Schumpeter, 69.

110. Warriner，“熊彼特与静态平衡”，49。

110. Warriner, “Schumpeter and Static Equilibrium,” 49.

111. Jeffrey B. Nugent 和 Pan A. Yotopoulos，“正统发展经济学从近期经验中学到了什么？” 《世界发展》，第 7 卷，1979 年，第 42 页。

111. Jeffrey B. Nugent and Pan A. Yotopoulos, “What Has Orthodox Development Economics Learned from Recent Experience? World Development, vol. 7, 1979, 42.

英文版序言

PREFACE TO THE ENGLISH EDITION

本书中提出的一些观点可以追溯到1907年；所有这些观点在1909年之前都已完善，当时对资本主义社会纯粹经济特征的分析框架基本成型，此后基本保持不变。本书于1911年秋季首次以德文出版。十年后，本书绝版，我虽有些不情愿，但还是同意出版第二版。第二版删去了第七章，重写了第二章和第六章，并进行了一些删减和增补。那是1926年。德文第三版只是第二版的重印，而目前的英文版也是由此改编而来。

SOME of the ideas submitted in this book go back as far as 1907; all of them had been worked out by 1909, when the general framework of this analysis of the purely economic features of capitalistic society took the shape which has remained substantially unaltered ever since. The book was published for the first time, in German, in the fall of 1911. When, after it had been out of print for ten years, I consented, not without some reluctance, to a second edition, I omitted the seventh chapter, rewrote the second and the sixth, and shortened and added here and there. This was in 1926. The third German edition is merely a reprint of the second, from which also the present English version has been made.

如果我说，我之所以没有对本书进行除阐述性内容之外的任何修改，是因为我认为它在每个细节上都令人满意，那么我对自己自本书出版以来所做的一切和所思所想，无疑是做出了非常不利的评价。尽管我仍然认为本书的框架——或者说“愿景”——以及最终的成果总体上是正确的，但在许多方面，我现在有了不同的看法。举个例子来说：当初我最初阐述商业周期理论（读者可以在第六章找到）时，我理所当然地认为只有一种单一的波状运动，即尤格拉发现的那种。现在我确信，至少存在三种这样的运动，甚至可能更多，而目前商业周期理论家面临的最重要的问题恰恰在于如何将它们区分开来，并描述它们相互作用所产生的现象。然而，这一要素并未被纳入后来的版本中。因为书籍就像孩子一样，一旦离开父母的家，就变成了独立的个体。他们过着自己的生活，作者们也一样。干涉他们是不可取的。他们已然成为这所房子的陌生人。这本书凭借自身努力，无论对错，都在其所处的时代和领域赢得了属于自己的一席之地。在我看来，最好是尽可能地保持它的原貌。若非我尊敬的朋友陶西格教授的建议和鼓励，我几乎不会想到要将其翻译成英文。

I should be passing a very damaging verdict on what I have done and thought since the book first appeared, if I were to say that my failure to make alterations of other than expository consequence was caused by a belief that it is satisfactory in every detail. Although I do consider both the outlines — what might be termed the “vision” — and the results as correct in the main, there are many points on which I now have another opinion. To mention but one by way of example: when the theory of the business cycle, which the reader finds in the sixth chapter, was first worked out, I took it for granted that there was a single wave-like movement, viz. that discovered by Juglar. I am convinced now that there are at least three such movements, probably more, and that the most important problem which at present faces theorists of the cycle consists precisely in isolating them and in describing the phenomena incident to their interaction. But this element has not been introduced into the later editions. For books, like children, become independent beings when once they leave the parents’ home. They lead their own lives, while the authors lead their own also. It will not do to interfere with those who have become strangers to the house. This book has fought its own way, and rightly or wrongly has won its place in the German literature of its time and field. It had seemed to me best to leave it undisturbed as much as possible. I should hardly have thought of an English translation but for the suggestion and encouragement of my eminent friend Professor Taussig.

出于类似的原因，我没有效仿我的恩师庞巴维克，他极其认真地对待每一条反对意见和批评，并在后来的版本中融入了自己的评论。我并非不尊重那些认真批评我论点的人，才尽量减少争议。但我必须承认，我从未遇到过任何能够真正说服我的、关于关键问题的反对意见。

For similar reasons, I have not followed the example of my great teacher Böhm-Bawerk, who with infinite care took notice of every objection or critique and embodied his own comments in his later editions. It is not any want of respect towards those who did me the honor of careful criticism of my argument that leads me to limit controversy to the minimum. I have to confess, however, that I have never come across an objection on essential points which carried conviction to my mind.

就目标和方法而言，本书坦率地说是“理论性的”。这里并非探讨方法论的场所。或许我现在对“事实性”研究和“理论性”研究之间的关系的看法与1911年有所不同。但我坚信，我们的科学与其他学科一样，都离不开我们称之为“理论”的那种精炼的常识，它为我们提供了处理事实和实际问题的工具。尽管大量未经分析的新事实，尤其是统计数据，对我们的理论体系产生了重要影响——毫无疑问，日益丰富的事实材料必然会不断启发新的理论模式，从而在当下悄然改进现有的理论结构——但在任何阶段，处理新事实，即处理尚未被现有定理涵盖的事实，都需要一定的理论知识。如果这种知识仍然停留在初级和潜意识层面，它或许是糟糕的理论，但它仍然是理论。例如，我始终无法说服自己，诸如兴趣来源之类的问题要么不重要，要么不有趣。无论如何，这只能是作者的过错。不过，我希望不久就能补充此处缺失的详细资料。通过对货币和信贷、利息和周期进行更“现实”的研究。

In aim and method, this book is frankly “theoretical.” This is no place for a professio fidei on method. Perhaps I think somewhat differently now about the relation between “factual” and “theoretical” research than I did in 1911. But my conviction stands that our science cannot, any more than others, dispense with that refined common-sense which we call “theory” and which provides us with the tools for approaching both facts and practical problems. However important may be the bearing of new masses of unanalysed, especially statistical, facts upon our theoretic apparatus — and undoubtedly increasing wealth of factual material must continually suggest new theoretical patterns, and thereby currently and silently improve any existing theoretical structure — at any given stage some theoretical knowledge is a prerequisite to dealing with new facts, that is with facts not already embodied in existing theorems. If this knowledge remains rudimentary and subconscious, it may be bad theory but it will not cease to be theory. I have not been able to convince myself, for example, that such questions as the source of interest are either unimportant or uninteresting. They could be made so, at all events, only by the fault of the author. I hope, however, to supply before long the detailed material which is here missing by more “realistic” studies in money and credit, interest, and cycles.

本书的论证构成了一个连贯的整体。这并非出于任何预先设定的计划。大约四分之一世纪前，当我开始研究利率和周期理论时，我并未预料到这些主题会彼此关联，并与企业家的利润、资金、信贷等密切相关，而这正是我论证思路的最终结果。但很快我就意识到，所有这些现象——以及许多次要现象——都只是一个独特过程的偶发事件，而某些能够解释它们的简单原则，也同样能够解释这个过程本身。由此，我自然而然地想到，这套理论体系或许可以与均衡理论进行对比，后者无论明示还是暗示，始终是传统理论的核心。起初，我用“静态”和“动态”这两个术语来指代这两种结构，但现在（出于对弗里施教授的尊重）我已彻底停止使用它们。取而代之的是其他一些或许略显笨拙的术语。但我坚持这种区分，因为我在目前的工作中反复发现它很有帮助。事实证明，即使在经济学领域之外，在所谓的文化演化理论中，这种区分也同样适用。文化演化理论在某些重要方面与本书的经济理论有着惊人的相似之处。这种区分本身也招致了许多批评。但是，将经营一家公司所涉及的现象与创建新公司所涉及的现象区分开来，真的就违背现实或人为吗？它又是否必然与“机械类比”有关呢？那些热衷于探究术语历史的人，如果愿意的话，不妨用动物学类比来解释；因为“静态”和“动态”这两个术语虽然含义不同，但确实是由约翰·斯图亚特·穆勒引入经济学的。穆勒很可能是从孔德那里借用了这两个术语，而孔德又告诉我们，他是从动物学家德·布兰维尔那里借用了这些术语。

The argument of the book forms one connected whole. This is not due to any preconceived plan. When I began to work on the theories of interest and of the cycle, nearly a quarter of a century ago, I did not suspect that these subjects would link up with each other and prove closely related to entrepreneurs’ profits, money, credit, and the like, in precisely the way in which the current of the argument led me. But it soon became clear that all these phenomena — and many secondary ones — were but incidents of a distinct process, and that certain simple principles which would explain them would explain also that process itself. The conclusion suggested itself that this body of theory might usefully be contrasted with the theory of equilibrium, which explicitly or implicitly always has been and still is the centre of traditional theory. I at first used the terms “statics” and “dynamics” for these two structures, but have now (in deference to Professor Frisch) definitively ceased to use them in this sense. They have been replaced by others, which are perhaps clumsy. But I keep to the distinction, having repeatedly found it helpful in my current work. This has proved to be so even beyond the boundaries of economics, in what may be called the theory of cultural evolution, which in important points presents striking analogies with the economic theory of this book. The distinction itself has met with much adverse criticism. But is it really untrue to life or artificial to keep separate the phenomena incidental to running a firm and the phenomena incidental to creating a new one? And has it necessarily anything to do with a “mechanical analogy”? Those who have a taste for delving into the history of terms should rather, if they feel so inclined, speak of a zoological analogy; for the terms static and dynamic were, although in a different sense, introduced into economics by John Stuart Mill. Mill probably had them from Comte, who, in turn, tells us that he borrowed them from the zoologist de Blainville.

我衷心感谢我的朋友雷德弗斯·奥皮博士，他他以无与伦比的友善承担了翻译这部极其困难的文本的艰巨任务。我们决定省略原著第一章和第三章的两个附录，以及其中的一些段落。在某些地方，我们对论述进行了修改，并重写了部分内容。由于论证本身并未改变，我认为无需列出所有改动。

My cordial thanks are due to my friend Dr. Redvers Opie, who with unparalleled kindness undertook the arduous task of translating a text which proved very refractory to the operation. We have decided to omit the two appendices to Chapters I and III of the original, and also passages or paragraphs here and there. In some places, the exposition has been modified and a number of pages have been rewritten. As the argument itself has nowhere been altered, I think it superfluous to give a list of the changes.

约瑟夫· A·S·熊彼特

JOSEPH A. SCHUMPETER

马萨诸塞州剑桥​

CAMBRIDGE, MASSACHUSETTS

1934年3月

March, 1934

经济发展理论

THE THEORY OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT

第一章

CHAPTER I

在既定环境下的经济生活循环流动1

THE CIRCULAR FLOW OF ECONOMIC LIFE AS CONDITIONED BY GIVEN CIRCUMSTANCES1

社会进程实际上是一个不可分割的整体。研究者的分类之手从这股洪流中人为地提取出经济事实。将某一事实称为经济事实本身就包含一种抽象，这是在精神上模仿现实的技术条件下强加给我们的众多抽象之一。事实绝非纯粹的经济事实；其他方面——而且往往更为重要——总是存在的。然而，我们在科学中谈论经济事实，正如我们在日常生活中谈论经济事实一样，并且拥有同样的权利；正如我们可以撰写文学史一样，即使一个民族的文学与其存在的所有其他要素密不可分。

THE social process is really one indivisible whole. Out of its great stream the classifying hand of the investigator artificially extracts economic facts. The designation of a fact as economic already involves an abstraction, the first of the many forced upon us by the technical conditions of mentally copying reality. A fact is never exclusively or purely economic; other — and often more important — aspects always exist. Nevertheless, we speak of economic facts in science just as in ordinary life, and with the same right; with the same right, too, with which we may write a history of literature even though the literature of a people is inseparably connected with all the other elements of its existence.

社会事实至少在直接意义上是人类行为的结果，经济事实则是经济行为的结果。后者可以定义为旨在获取商品的行为。在这个意义上，我们也可以谈论行动的经济动机、社会和经济生活中的经济力量等等。然而，由于我们只关注通过交换或生产来获取商品的经济行为，我们将把经济行为的概念限定在这些获取方式上，而将更广泛的范畴留给经济动机和经济力量的概念，因为我们需要在讨论经济行为的狭窄领域之外使用这两个概念。

Social facts are, at least immediately, results of human conduct, economic facts results of economic conduct. And the latter may be defined as conduct directed towards the acquisition of goods. In this sense we also speak of an economic motive to action, of economic forces in social and economic life, and so forth. However, since we are concerned only with that economic conduct which is directed towards the acquisition of goods through exchange or production, we shall restrict the concept of it to these types of acquisition, while we shall leave that wider compass to the concepts of economic motive and economic force, because we need both of them outside the narrower field within which we shall speak of economic conduct.

因此，经济事实领域首先是由经济行为的概念界定的。每个人至少在某种程度上都必须从事经济活动；每个人要么是“经济主体”（Wirtschaftssubjekt），要么依赖于经济主体。一旦社会群体成员在职业上专业化，然而，我们可以区分出以经济活动或商业活动为主要活动的群体，以及其他群体，在这些群体中，经济活动被其他活动所掩盖。在这种情况下，经济生活由一个特殊的群体来代表，尽管社会中的所有其他成员也必须从事经济活动。因此，可以说这个群体的活动构成了经济生活（κα τ' ὲξoχἠv），尽管经济生活在此意义上与人们的其他重要表现形式有着千丝万缕的联系，但这样说不再意味着抽象的概念。

The field of economic facts is thus first of all delimited by the concept of economic conduct. Everyone must, at least in part, act economically; everyone must either be an “economic subject” (Wirtschaftssubjekt) or be dependent upon one. As soon as the members of social groups become occupationally specialised, however, we can distinguish classes of people, whose chief activity is economic conduct or business, from other classes in which the economic aspect of conduct is overshadowed by other aspects. In this case, economic life is represented by a special group of people, although all other members of society must also act economically.
